The pesto gnocchi was very yummy and hand made. The men seemed very, very happy with their steak. They both had 180gms each. It seemed like quite a small portion when served, although actually filled them up.The desserts were unremarkable, if not disappointing, and so I would recommend you pass on this here, and try other establishments to finish off your meal. One friend had a taste of his tiramisu and left it. The 'dolci latte' pudding were overly fried bites which just weren't pleasant.Our waiter was particularly engaging, and service was excellent, so a big tick here.For obvious reasons I wouldn't return, but if meat is what you want, this does seem like one of the best places to come in London.Given that raw hanging aging meat is stored and 'decorated' throughout, I certainly wouldn't bring especially sensitive or squeamish vegetarians.Also, I would definitely reserve a table in advance, as there is a good chance you would otherwise be turned away.
1213: Review: Sono stata a cena venerdì 6 marzo. Ristorante prenotato da mio figlio che vive a Londra.Cibo fantastico, ho mangiato la lingua che adoro e direi perfetta con la sua salsina verde.Tagliata nuda buonissima e il latte fritto meraviglioso.L'unico neo, che ho detto anche al cameriere gentilissimo e alla cameriera carinissima, entrambi italiani, l' acustica. Noi eravamo nella saletta sotto, difficile fare conversazione per il rumore degli altri avventori. Forse, mi permetto di suggerire, aggiungere qualcosa che assorba il rumore. Le piastrelle carine ma non aiutano. Comunque Bravi!!!
1214: Review: All food was top class, from the side dishes to the steak. Finally a place that uses a really good olive oil at the table. The wine range is really good, the red from Calabria is superb and not overpriced. Service a little slow. Only slightly negative note: I wish they would offer a good cannonau from Sardinia.Overall : this place is really really good.
1215: Review: pour un prix tout de même élevé nous avons eu une fin de cote de boeuf pleine de gras, immangeable. Le service est prévenant mais presque trop.
1216: Title: "un pezzo di Genova nel centro di Londra"
Review: siamo stati qui la settimana scorsa.....ottima cena..Steak tartare favolosagrandiiiii....e forza Genoa!!!!
1217: Title: Not a place for vegetarians!

Review: After reading some favourable reviews about this restaurant we decided to lunch here prior to a site seeing afternoon in London.We were very impressed with the "in restaurant" butchery counter with all the meats on display to enable you to pick your cut of meat. We however, opted for the rump steak. My husband opted for the steak with Gorgonzola and walnuts and I chose mine with pears in balsamic. As sides we ordered one portion of chips and one of roasted vegetables. Although the portions were small it was adequate for lunch. The taste did not disappoint and despite some sinewy sections was enjoyable.We would recommend ordering larger portions of meat if you have a big appetite as you can order any amount and the price is quoted by the kilogram.The restaurant itself looks unimposing from the exterior and perhaps a little off putting but once inside the welcome and service by the staff over comes that.There is a good selection of wines and the staff will recommend at a reasonable price which ever compliments your meal.Nice experience but not sure if I would go again.
1218: Title: About as great of a steak as you will find in London...

Review: I live in arguably the greatest steak area in the world - Texas. That said, I'm not easily impressed with most steak / meat restaruants. Advance apologies to London steak lovers, but it's not a city I would typically visit for a steak. However, Macellaio Roberto Costa breaks the mold and I enthusiastically recommend it for a terrific slab of beef / meat experience. It's also a great place for a fun group. Loud, lively and good energy - in South Ken where there's always a buzz with lots to do - good pubs, wine bar, clubs, etc. Beef is outstanding Prime quality (Genoa equivalent) and dry aged. The only knock/s on the place is the wine list which is a bit drab (and over priced) relative to the outstanding meat quality and also the fact that you are asked how you want your meat cooked but only really allowed medium rare - which I like any way, but don't ask someone what they want if you only cook it one way. Two bottles of wine, several course meal for 3 people and 350 quid with tip. Not the cheapest place on the planet but I still highly recommend. Lovely people, fabulous meat and a great environment. I look forward to going back!
1219: Review: Siamo stati qui con la Mia famiglia Sabato scorso e devo dire Che la scelta si e rilevata fantastica come la carne ed un Valpolicella velluto Che il nome la dice lunga.Lo consiglio a chi cerca buon cibo e ottima accoglienza.
1220: Review: Try it, amazing quality, very careful choice of ingredients from Italy.Nice atmosphere, book in advance. Not cheap. Nice selection of wines, from the "obvious" ones to some you don't necessarily find commonly even in Italy.
1221: Review: My wife booked us a table for Valentine's night and, as a meat lover, this was truly heaven. The front of the restaurant is like a butchers shop, with all the hung meats on display. There's a little bar and some high tables in the front room and nice relaxed seating area through the back. It feels very authentic, you are surrounded by the Italian language, smells and, of course, beautiful foccacia drenched in olive oil and balsamic vinegar. They strike the right balance between formal and relaxed. The staff are fantastic, very warm greetings, always smiling, attentive and very happy to tell you everything they can about the food & wine. Special praise to the sommelier - on requesting a recommendation, he described several wines and their vineyards in such intricate detail you could almost taste the wind of the Ligurian coast. We decided upon one of his recommendations, only for him to return to tell us he was very embarrassed but they'd actually sold out, so he upgraded us to a lovely Cerico Rosso, for the price of the original. A great find and happy with the price. Food wise, everything was delicious. My only slight complaint would be after the success of the wine recommendations, we told the waiter we knew we wanted a t-bone for main, but asked for them to choose us some light starters. Bearing in mind we had already ordered a large t-bone for the main, we assumed they'd bring us a salad with some cheese and cold cuts for starter. Instead a steak tartare and carpaccio arrived, with just a small handful of rocket on the board. Both the tartare and carpaccio were delicious, but I looked enviously at the hams and cheeses on other tables - this was almost at the point of red meat overload. We did eventually order some extra leaves and cheese (beautiful gorgonzola!) but I was a bit disappointed that we didn't get to sample some of the gorgeous hams we'd seen on our way in. I will return to try those next time! So onto the main, a 900g t-bone, perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked and quite possibly the most tender steak we've ever had - it really was magical, delivered to the table with a little fanfare. The sides are good, not quite up to the standard of the rest of the meal, but nice enough. The way they dress the steaks is, I'm assuming, authentic - just a little olive oil, rosemary and seasoning, which really helps to promote the steak's natural flavour. But after 400g or so, I was wishing for a little sauce just to help finish things off. I don't think they offer any sauces at Macellaio's (maybe this is very un-Italian?), but really no complaints here. We didn't quite finish the steak, but it was a valiant effort. We tried to save some space for the cheesecake, which we'd heard was divine, and it was, but by this stage we were fit to burst. We could only share a single dessert, but I'll be back to try the tiramisu next time we go. We'll return to Macellaio's for certain, next time I'll remember to wear some looser trousers! I probably wouldn't recommend for vegetarians or non beef eaters, but if you love a steak this is the Italian Goodman's. And if I could give more than 5* for service I would. Every member of staff shook my hand and wished us a great night as we left...I felt like the Godfather!
1222: Title: Carne italiana nel cuore di londra

Review: Ogni volta che vado a londra non posso fare a meno di andare al Macellaio,carne ottima sia cruda che cotta... Mi e' capitato di assaggiare un piatto chiamato"l'orecchia"... ( non e' davvero un orecchia)... Fantastico!!! ... Il servizo e' eccellente ,lo chef , giovane, ma molto capace! Lo staff molto professionale. Vi consiglio di provarlo!
1223: Review: We were there for my daughter's birthday dinner. We were 8 people. The place is nice but we found two problems. We ordered a selection of cold starters and then the T bone steak with spinach and fries. Two problems: 1) It was painfully slow. 2) The steaks looked wonderful and were cooked perfectly but were incredibly tough. Everyone commented on how tough they were. Sad, because the concept is brilliant.
1224: Title: Amazing food, average service, rude guests.

Review: I was there for my b-day dinner, the food is simply amazing, t-bone was perfect, tartar also a great taste, wine of the house, very competitive...Unfortunately the customers (4 late twenty's guys) sit next to us wasn't the perfectly gentleman's , rude conversation, high tones and bad words, like they probably speak in their Italian housesProbably the the management should say something in some circumstances. Average service even if the waitress suggest us what she like (everything) and forgot to ask the way to cook the t-bone.
1225: Review: Excellent meat, sides and perfect wine to accompany the meal. Also good service and atmosphere. Good value for the money. What more could I ask :) Will definitely visit again.
1226: Title: Cannot be surpassed for steak but......

Review: Macellaio is like a butcher's shop with food - the window is full of amazing meat imported from Italy and all the steaks are cut to your specification. One t bone steak is enough to feed two people as they are enormous. However if you are not a carnivore the choice is limited and we were very disappointed in the side dishes - our saute potatoes, spinach and cannellini beans came on a tea plate sized plate for the both of us which was a little underwhelming. You can see they are very knowledgable about their meat and their wine and they give the clients plenty of attention which is very nice to see - for us and this is personal is was a bit style over substance. But if you like steak and you like huge portions of it this is the place to.
1227: Title: Our favourite restaurant in the UK

Review: This place is incredible. It’s a family run Italian with the BEST steak I’ve ever eaten. The balsamic olive oil and the delicious bread is unlike any other restaurant let alone the starter, main and desert!Everything is the highest quality. From the mozzarella, to the meat, from the wine, to the service - Exceptional.The service is unlike any other. They brought us complimentary glasses of Prosecco before we had taken our coats off. They are so knowledgable about the wines and meats. The atmosphere is so wonderful. We are heading back for the third time this Friday for our Valentines date night and we both cannot wait! That cheesecake is calling my name!
1228: Title: carne piemontese nel cuore di Londra

Review: locale molto intrigante e intimo con uno straodinario bancone che all'entrata espone le migliori carni piemontesi . il personale è straordinariamente gentile e professionale . il servizio è di tipo 'informale' ma nulla è lasciato al caso . i ragazzi del Macellaio, guidati da Robi Costa, ti guidano verso le scelte migliori. ho gustato una tartare (tagliata al coltello) buonissima e una costata di Fassone piemontese straordinaria . per finire la loro cheesecake è sublime . vino Pinot Nero delle Marche da urlo . prezzi assolutamente nella media della zona e del tipo di locale.insomma una splendida sorpresa nel cuore di South Kensington dove la carne piemontese guarda dritta negli occhi gli angus di oltremanica, anzi, dall'alto in basso.
1229: Review: splendida location, personale preparato e cordiale, cibo e vino ottimi...unica pecca un pò caro...ma a Londra, si sa, poche cose sono economiche!
1230: Review: Ex Maxèla ora rilevato dal bravo Roberto.Carne rigorosamente Fassona di qualità e cucinata in maniera impeccabile.Belle ragazze vi servono ai tavoli pieni ovviamente di italiani ma anche di compiti signori inglesi.Ambiente simpatico e caldo, tartare eccellenti, buona scelta di vini, prezzi in linea con la cara Londra.Solo il pane è da rivedere ma è peccato veniale.
1231: Title: se vi piace mangiare e basta

Review: Il posto non mi piace, molto semplice, servizio lento. Io non ho mai tolto il cappotto perche si ghiacciava. La carne cosi ' si puo mangiare tranquillamente altrove (goodman) senza andare a south ken per chi non e' di mano. Fra l ' altro sia a me che al mio ragazzo ci e' rimansto tutto sullo stomaco tutto il giorno. Il pane e' molto buono servito caldo.
1232: Review: Locale molto bello!!già dalla vetrina che da sulla strada si capisce che è un unconventional...ubicato in una via molto bella e abbastanza chic ...queste costate appese in bella vista sono motivo per curiosare all interno.Una volta entrati si respira l aria di casa sia per come è arredato sia per la calda accoglienza del personale-pezzi ricercati ma al tempo stesso comuni collocati in una bella atmosferauna volta seduti diamo una rapida sbirciata al menù scritto su carta che ricorda i vecchi quotidiani con tanto di disegni per illustrare i piatti e gli animali da cui derivanoOrdiniamo del fegato con burro salvia , della lingua come antipasto ed una fantastica costata come portata principale; tutto questo accompagnato da una bottiglia di vino che chiamare "della casa" non renderebbe l idea ma è proprio così!finita la cena m ero riservato un posticino per terminare in bellezza con un bel pezzo di gorgonzola stagionata che oserei definire "paradisiaca " mentre la mia compagna si dilettava con una torta al cioccolato altrettanto speciale.Esperienza fantastica, prezzo giustissimo , ambiente amichevole e riassante; lo consiglierei a chiunque andasse a fare un giro in quel di Londra
1233: Title: So good to spend time to write it...

Review: I went with a friend and the quality of the produce is much higher than in Italy. Staff is awesome (ok I'm Italian and I felt at home!) and according to London's prices is not expensive at all.
1234: Review: My boyfriend brought me here for a wonderful Saturday night date night. He had been here once before hadn't stopped talking about it... And now I know why! This place is a fabulous meaty delight! Staff on the evening were attentive and knowledgable about all things food and wine.We had the tasting board with steak tartare to start with and we couldn't eat it fast enough it was so flavoursome. Our meat for main was slightly fatty but still an equally wonderful delight for our mouths. Last but not least (and a snap last minute decision) the cheesecake - OMG, words can not describe this (although I will try!) it was like a smooth cheesy sugary experience that dissolved and left a little bit of heaven in your mouth. A must try! Actually this entire restaurant should come with a must try sticker. Highly recommended.
1235: Review: Felt like a trendy Roman restaurant, place was incredibly buzzy and I'd say well over half the clientele were Italian. Steaks from the butchers section out front were phenomenal - the Fiorentine TBone quite exceptional and a little bit better than the rib we also had. Starter plate was underwhelming but mains easily made up for it. Chips have massively improved and the mustard and rosemary oil were sensational. Service was a little scatty as we got towards the end (annoying when you're trying to pay the bill) but friendly throughout. Top night.
1236: Review: Visited on a busy Friday evening just for a bottle of wine, we also had complimentary wooden board of bresaola which was fabulous! Booked a table for the Saturday night, it was brilliant, you have to be a meat lover but it's fabulous. Menu fainrly limited but amazing. Worth a visit if in London. Recommended
1237: Review: we ordered selection of starters between 9 of us - various cold meats, lard (!), salami, steak tartare (not my favourite but that was enjoyed by those who had it)then a lovely little pasta entrée, some gnocchi in pesto and pasta in tomato sauce - this was very tasty and an ideal selection as part of a larger meal (small plate)the main was three enormous steaks between the 9 of us - beautifully tender, so so tasty .... with a bit of veg/potatoes to supplement .... fantastic meal!dessert was an effort, but we pulled through, very tasty selections!all through the meal, the chat and banter from the waiters complemented the meal, excellent service, efficient, not too quick, not too slow
1238: Review: We booked Macellaio based on trip adviser reviews and weren't disappointed! We arrived a little early but were sat no problem in the back which had a great ambience. We were given the menu and time to read the great background of the meat. A very helpful waiter came over and explained some different parts of the menu and also wine matched for us with a lovely red wine. The bread was amazing which we were given to snack on so well worth going hungry as all sooo nice!I had the rump with pears which was lovely with only a small chewy piece. Boyfriend had 500g rib which was on the bone and shown to us raw before cooking. Both steaks were cooked to order and asking and both were delicious! We got some roast potatoes and roast veg to share which was more than enough though just the meat would have been great! We had coffee to finish with which was lovely too.Wouldn't suggest it for a veggie meal obviously but for any meat eaters it's heaven!The whole experience was great and the food, waiters and everything was lovely. Would recommend and come back as other people's food looked lovely.
1239: Review: If you like beef, this will be one of the best steak dinners of your life. I regularly eat at top restaurants all over the US and abroad for business and pleasure, but have to say dinner at Macellaio was unforgettable. My family was in London for Christmas and we hit all the top restaurants, including Gordon Ramsay's restaurant, the Ritz etc. and this was by far the best. Food was amazing, ambiance was unique and staff was tops. While we waited for our table we received samples of the best prochutto we'd had in our lives (no kidding). Subsequently, we let the staff basically order the entire dinner for us and it couldn't have been better. I heard about Macellaio's at a business dinner in Chicago at Del Frisco's months earlier and the person raved about it. Told my wife and she tried to change to another restaurant at last minute, but luckily I insisted. We all agreed after the trip, this was one of the highlights of our trip. Don't miss it if you can get a reservation!
1240: Review: Di solito all'estero non andiamo mai in ristoranti italiani, ma c'è lo avevano consigliato amici fidatissimi e abbiamo deciso di provare.Il posto ė davvero particolare negli arredi ed accogliente e la qualità dei cibi in generale e della carne in particolare è davvero sopra la media.Ottima la scelta di vini, gradevolissimo il Sangiovese "della casa". Ci siamo affidati ai consigli di Roberto e abbiamo assaggiato un tagliere misto di salumi prodotti da loro e una selezionata scelta di formaggi, proseguito con un tris di battuta di fassona piemontese cruda con condimenti vari e una imperiale tagliata, sempre di fassona. Il tutto accompagnato da una buona bottiglia di Sangiovese, e completato da tiramisù (come quello della mia nonna) caffè e limoncino finale.. Tutto buonissimo e con un conto finale più che corretto. Ci sentiamo di straconsigliarvelo. Bravi bravi bravi... È un piacere trovare questa eccellenza italiana all'estero.
1241: Title: Une viande d'une qualité rare !

Review: Nous y sommes allés le 1 janvier et nous avons adoré. Le cadre est très sympathique, la musique vous mets tt de suite dans l'ambiance, le personnel est charmant et la viande terrible ! Nous avons pris une assiette de dégustation avec du carpaccio, de la viande sechée, du saucisson, du tatare. C'etait vraiment extra, les accompagnements sont divers dc vous pouvez facilement a plusieurs prendre un peu de tout et partager. Les carnivores et les grandes faim pourront trouver de quoi les sustenter. Les prix sont tout de meme plus élevé qu'ailleurs mais on sort ravis et ca vaut vraiment le coup !
1242: Review: My family went for dinner while visiting London and this was by far the best meal we had on our trip. The server ordered for us and brought out a tremendous meal. All the meat was incredible and the prosciutto was the best I've had in my life. Would definitely recommend to others.
1243: Title: Best Steak of My Life

Review: We frequently passed by the Macelliao Restaurant during our stay nearby in South Kensington and wondered what was hiding behind the meat hanging in the window. It turned out to be the best meal we had during our stay. We adore American steak houses and I was intrigued by the concept of an Italian one. We shared a 1kg rib eye steak which was cooked to absolute perfection accompanied by some lovely hand cut fries, spinach and Sicilian style roasted vegetables. We shared a tiramisu for dessert which was also delicious. Great personal service too. Do not hesitate to book this marvellous restaurant.
1244: Title: ambasciatore cucina italiana in UK

Review: Bravi,bravissimi. Carne da favola, location orginale,servizio professionale ma con grande cortesia ( e capacita' di orientare il cliente). Rapporto qualita' prezzo molto buono. Si po' chiedere di piu'? Restare sempre cosi'
1245: Review: It's rare for us to find a restaurant that we can truly describe as excellent. Macellaio Roberto Costa makes it simple. If you are a carnivore, you may not want to leave.You might miss it as you walk down Old Brompton Road so look for the red leather sofa outside. Then enter through a narrow passageway with their glassed in butcher's window, butcher's counter and block on your left. The front room is small and intimate several tall tables in front of a cozy (and equally small) bar. The back room is larger, but when all the tables are full (as they are likely to be) there is a similar coziness and intimacy.The staff know their meat and wine. Trust them to recommend. They are professional in appearance and presentation and they know everything about their products. What a pleasant experience to be able to discuss one's preferences and then rely on the staff to fulfil precisely what is discussed. Especially so with Campari spritzers in hand. Our first course consisted of steak tartare, tongue, heart, and liver (all beef). Each dish was excellently prepared and complemented each other.Our main course consisted of a 1.6kg TBone with large filet (4th rib?), 700g ribeye, and a perfectly prepared steak Milanese. The TBone and ribeye were both done medium rare - warm red center and pink to the edge. Not a speck of brown in sight save for the outside charring. In the end, it was a bit too much, but well worth the reasonable prices. The wine pairing was perfect - no wine list needed with the staff's thoughtful recommendation - and, surprise, far from the most expensive wine!Desserts were tasty but not the reason to visit. We declined complimentary after dinner drinks, but what a thoughtful gesture. We have been to all the major steakhouses in London. Macellaio Roberto Costa tops them all in our opinion. Long may they thrive.
1246: Title: Great ambiance but steak a little tough

Review: You cannot fault the waiters here, the attention given to explain the beef. My partner had spinach soup which he loved to start. We shared the T bone steak as it is large. We ordered two side veg. Everything was good. The steak took a little chewing though. We had a lovely bottle of red wine at 32 pounds and the bill came out at 125.00. For what we had a little on the high side we thought.I wouldn't recommend it for value for money but as somewhere different the people are lovely.
1247: Review: We went here last weekend and were not impressed. The waitress was unhelpful, the menu items we wanted had run out and the steak we did have was lacking in flavour. It was a shame becuase the ambiance and style was good.
1248: Review: Che dire... a trovarli posti cosi...siamo davanti a qualita eccellente, servizio ineccepibile, e ottima qualita in rapporto al prezzo che a londra non e' poco credetemi... il proprietario roberto e i suoi collaboratori vi delizieranno con una cucina e una gentilezza da 1000 e una notte...complimenti davvero
1249: Review: Make a reservation some time in advance. Pleasant small restaurant, friendly waiters, good wine and very good food.
1250: Review: Surprising to find an Italian restaurant purely dedicated to meat but what a pleasent surprise! Besides your regular steaks you get tongue for example. One the best tartar starters I have ever eaten and everything else was very tasty indeed - exceptionally good meat. For carnivores you can definitely recommend this place.
1251: Title: CONSIGLIATISSIMO SOPRATTUTTO PER LA CARNE

Review: Veramente un buon ristorante.Quando ci si arriva si rimane un po' sconcertati ,in effetti entri in una macelleria con carne esposta per la vendita . Sono tutti italiani .La carne viene tagliata e cucinata al momento ed è ottima .Ovviamente servono anche primi ,contorni e quant'altro ,tutti buoni, ma la carne è la loro specialità. I prezzi sono un po' altini, ma quando si mangia bene si sopportano .Andateci.
1252: Title: A Londra la carne migliore è anche Italiana!!

Review: Non conoscevo questo locale in Italia, ma me l'hanno consigliato mentre ero in viaggio di lavoro a Londra, come alternativa ai locali dove di solito vado a mangiare carne. Devo dire che è stata una piacevolissima scoperta: il locale è piccolino ma molto caratteristico, con un bancone da macellaio all'ingresso e appunto un macellaio che prepara la carne "a vista". E poi quando arrivano i piatti, molto curati, si possono assaporare ottimi pezzi di carne italiana molto saporiti e cucinati molto bene. Un assaggio di ottima cucina italiana a Londra!! Tenetelo presente! Io ci tornerò senz'altro!
1253:
Review: 3rd time we go there. 
Always a pleasure.
Imperial starter is full of delicious food, then 1kg of fiorentina to complete a perfect meal!
We'll go there soon again!
1 tip, I suggest to sit upstairs which is nicer!
1254: Review: This restaurant has a nice atmosphere but it is overpriced. If you are having dinner I would surely advise to have meat only, as the rest is pretty average.And do not buy meat at their butcher shop under any circumstances, they make prices on the spot and they are very very unreasonable!
1255: Review: Un sabato sera londinese, sono passato casualmente davanti a questo locale di South Kensington e sono stato attirato da una vetrina di carne esposta , bella e ben frollata. Ho così rotto con un mio atteggiamento consolidato negli anni , " all'estero non si mangia italiano ", ed ho scoperto il Macellaio. Ottima carne, ambiente piccolo ma gradevole, servizio amichevole e abbastanza preciso, cantina non grandissima ma di buona qualità. Ben frequentato è obbligatorio prenotare, io sono stato solo fortunato. Prezzi adeguati a South Kensington , quindi un pò alti.
1256: Review: This is a very lively, noisy and busy place - be prepared for that and you'll love it. Our reservation was at 10:30 and they were still packed when we got there. At first we were crammed into the bar and given a snack while we waited. Check out the meat counter up front while you are waiting.We were seated down stairs (I'd recommend upstairs if possible) and the 4 of us started with the Burrata and tartare/carpaccio sampler - 3 of each and way too much but we still loved it. The waitress recommended the bone-in beef rib eye - 4kg - which was way too much. We didn't finish till well after midnight. Great food and a great experience - I consider the inconsistent service part of their 'experience'. And definitely get a reservation well in advance - it will increase your odds of enjoying this yummy food at a reasonable hour.
1257: Review: Individuato tramite le recensione di Tripadvisor, si è rivelato eccellente! La fiorentina squisita: erano anni che non ne mangiavo una così e mai ad immaginare di trovarla a Londra! I bambini, che usualmente snobbano la pasta al sugo cucinata fuori casa, hanno gustato con piacere le tagliatelle al ragù di fassona. Contorni altrettanto gustosi così come la scelta dei vini veramente all'altezza. Confesso che desidererei avere vicino casa un locale così per poter mangiare più spesso pietanze a base di carne di questo livello!
1258: Title: If you like meat - this is the place if you are hungry

Review: While we are not big meat eaters, we enjoyed the experience. Service was not the best due to being busy, but they are forgiven for the quality of the food. The staff were most knowledgeable and proud of their products.The Entrecote, Toscana Extravirgine with Rosemary, rock salt was perfectly cooked.The Filetto – tenderloin with Toscano extravergine, while under-cooked to the other person's personal liking, the inner parts were too moist and juicy (red) but it was tender.Overall - an very enjoyable experience.
1259: Review: In pieno South Kensington, questo ristorante di moda, oltre ad avere una buona cantina, offre la migliore carne di Londra. Ottimi i crudi in antipasto e la Fiorentina. Servizio buono, bisogna prenotare perché e' sempre pieno.
1260: Review: I've been here three times. Have come back only for the food, however the service has always been extremely dissapointing. 45 mins table waiting even with a reservation (this has happened twice!) . Had to wait an average of 20 mins every time we asked for a bottle of wine and had two wait around 40 mins between courses! Service is extremely slow and poor, and waiters were rude when we had complained. We asked for dishes that never arrived....Refused to pay service charge at the end.Got for food but not for a dining experience or good service.
1261: Review: Se você é carnívoro não deixe de visitar este restaurante em Londres! A localização é ótima: próximo ao metro e numa rua com vários restaurantes. A decoração é sensacional e o atendimento muito bom, mas o melhor de tudo é a carne! Comi uma bisteca a la fiorentina sensacional! Muito melhor do que a que comi em Florença numa viagem recente! A carne é macia e leve! Você come meio kg de carne e ainda quer mais. O preço não é barato, mas vale muito a visita!
1262: Review: Tutto assolutamente impeccabile, dalla splendida cortesia della ragazza all'ingresso alla professionalità del titolare. Cibo ottimo, atmosfera straordinaria. Ho lasciato il locale fiero di essere italiano, cosa che per altri ristoranti italiani a Londra non è assolutamente accaduta.Consigliatissimo
1263: Review: If you have a good vegetarian friend, do not take him or her there ! But if you like tasty Italian products, wines and red (very red) tender meat then you are in the right place. The service is very friendly and efficient. This is a restaurant where they love what they are doing and they are serious about it.
1264: Title: Per chi ama la carne un must!

Review: Per voi italiani che dopo un po' a Londra non sopportate piu' l'odore delle spezie orientali che si insinuano ovunque, questo posto fa per voi!La carne viene tagliata all'ingresso del ristorante da un macellaio italiano. Italiana e' la carne di fassona piemontese. Italiani il proprietario e chi ci lavora. Grande professionalita' e gentilezza genuina ne fanno un posto dove tornare spesso. Lo consiglio a tutti i carnivori come me!
1265: Review: L'esperienza con la nuova gestione e' stata soddisfacente. Il locale e' carino, metterei delle luci un po' piu' soffuse al piano sotto, il servizio impeccabile. Abbiamo mangiato della carne deliziosa e bevuto del buon vino italiano a prezzi ragionevoli. Giudizio complessivamente buono anche se avrei voluto mangiare un po' di piu'. La costata alla fine non era cosi' grande come pensavamo quando l'abbiamo scelta. Buoni gli starters e buoni i contorni.Il prezzo e' ragionevole. Ci tornero' per togliermi la soddisfazione di una costatona gigante,
1266: Review: There was a large group of us, around 15 people.They provided us with the Private dining room, and we had 3/4 waiters that looked after us, who were very knowledgeable and very professional.The Chef also came out and explained about the dishes and the Beef, where its from and what's it fed on.The food was very good, very tasty, very fresh and honest.Even the owner introduced himself and made us feel welcome.Will definitely return, and up there with the likes of Goodmans and Hawksmoor.
1267: Title: One of our best meals in London

Review: Wasnt sure what to expect with the slabs of meat hanging in the window and the red couch outside. Was it a butcher? A steakhouse?  Ended up being the best steak Ive ever tasted and a fabulous meal. Thank you!
1268: Review: I am definitely a meat eater, and as I work in South Kensington I have passed this restaurant with the red sofa outside many times. In fact it's referred to in our office as the red sofa place, though until I recently ate there no-one was quite sure what it was, whether it was a butchers, a restaurant or something else. I went with two other colleagues as a goodbye meal for one of them. I let the boys pick the meat and just settled myself down to enjoy the food. And enjoy it I did. While two of us were waiting for the third we received a complimentary selection of smoked thin slices of beef which literally melted in your mouth. The waiter was a little slow at times in seeing to us, but as we had set aside 2 hours for lunch that wasn't too much of a problem. The chef and butcher was brilliant, he helped the guys pick out the steak we wanted - which was huge and split between three of us, and he cooked it to perfection. We did not leave this restaurant hungry...infact we even decided to go all out and have dessert, and wow that was worth it. It's not cheap to eat here, but oh, if you love steak - go for it!
1269: Title: A rare find - every ingredient brought in from small farms in Italy where old fashion natural methods still practiced.

Review: The Butcher Lello has his cuts of finest meats including hand cut beef tartare, cured prosciutto steaks cut to order showcased as you walk in. Everything is handmade, including breads and pastas. Wines are brought in from small vineyards in Italy. We enjoyed every morsel. The venue has a wonderful atmosphere and the price was reasonable. All the staff very warm and friendly. One of our best meals in London.
1270: Review: atmosfera e accoglienza molto buone,carne di qualità ottima e dolci squisiti.ho assaggiato un vermentino nero..da urlo!straconsigliato
1271: Review: Great food and good service, even after waiting over 45mins to be seated (we did make a booking) we really enjoyed our time there.
1272: Review: I paid £15 for slow cooked Pork Belly, what i got was some very fine slithers of fat on a slice of toast?? What you see coming in, you expect more. friends shared rump steak that was like leather. I wouldn't recommend, or go there again.
1273: Title: Lovely place for both meat-eaters and vegetarians

Review: I have taken my boyfriend to this restaurant for his birthday, since he is a big meat lover. I was worried before coming to this place for two reasons: first, because it's not easy to find good quality, nicely cooked meat in a restaurant, so I was afraid my boyfriend would be disappointed; second, because I am a vegetarian, so worried that there would be not much for me to eat, and that it would not be nice as it is often the case with vegetarian options in mostly-meat restaurants. However, we were both instead very happy with the experience. My boyfriend absolutely loved both his meat appetisers and main course. The meat was very high quality and cooked perfectly. The presentation of the plates was also very pretty. My cheese starter (stracciatella) and my main (homemade gnocchi) were also delicious. Desserts were latte fritto for me and tiramisu for my boyfriend, and they were among the nicest things we ever had in London. The interior and atmosphere were also cool , and service excellent, with a very friendly waiter. We'll definitely come back for the next special occasion.
1274: Review: In this quarter of Old Brompton Road (not far from South Kensington tube) lies a handful of Italian wine bars, coffee houses, and restaurants. This restaurant has a small up-stairs but down a short staircase is a larger eating area. The staff greet you with courtesy and some Italian charm. The décor is simple and has a real feeling of family dining rather than up-market chic. You are made to feel comfortable and welcome. Eating here is about meat, especially 'T' bone steaks which are on show, so you can see what you're getting beforehand. The vegetable side dishes were, again, simple and straightforward, but tasty. The espresso was mind-bendingly strong - lovely. Desserts were not as good as other courses, almost an afterthought. Price was ok for London. Very busy place to so recommend booking.
1275: Review: Absolutely fantastic!Top quality meat and Lello TheButcher is the number 1!Lello made us feel like at home, and he served great delicacies, all accompanied by a good glass of red.The RibEye was perfectly cooked and really tasty.It's not a restaurant, it is a "culinary experience".Only negative: I am disappointed by the behaviour of the Assistant Manager (bold with the suit) that with a few jokes "out of the place" has almost ruined the atmosphere!
1276: Review: Good red meat, Italian style. Busy and boisterous and somehow not noisy. Bring a large appetite. Try to have a back-up thought when ordering wine.
1277: Review: Very simple - buy large piece of delicious beef, have them grill it for you and wash down with red wine. The quality of the meat is outstanding with the added benefit of being (apparently) cholesterol reducing. What more could you ask for, guilt-free steak! The room is simple so the focus is on the food, the staff can seem quite hassled, even brusque, but probably because they are rushed off their feet. We've been three times now in pretty quick succession and when your teenage daughter declares it as her favourite restaurant then you know we'll be back soon! I only wish the wine list was a bit longer and more adventurous.
1278: Title: Great Surprise on Old Brompton Rd

Review: We were in London recently walking to our hotel and saw this beautiful aged meat hanging in the window of a shop. We had to walk in and explore and found this place is an Italian meat market and a restaurant. They had room for us the next night so made reservations. So glad we did as we were rewarded to some of the finest Italian style steak, something near and dear to me. I have spent a lot of time in Italy dining in and out and cooking the huge Chianina porter house steak. Love it seared rare with EVOO and crunchy salt. This restaurant serves aged Fassone beef imported from Italy and it is some of the finest steak available and cooked to perfection with wonderful sides. A great and not absurdly marked up wine list made this a location to never miss while in London. This is the real deal. Way over exceeded my expectation. Bravo!
1279: Review: We had dinner there on a Thursday night - overall, a poor experience. We booked a table, and we got it almost half an hour late. Then, it took another long while for our order to be collected and the food to be served: the appetizer arrived with the main course, the potatoes were cold, and one main course had been completely forgotten; by the time we got everything that we wanted, I was hungry and tired. The waiter tried to make up for the delay by not making me pay for the steak, which was appreciated but too late. At the tables around me I could see waiters dropping stuff all the time or bringing other clients their dessert, only to snatch it away from them while they were digging in with their spoons - leaving everybody in the room puzzled: wrong order? Food gone bad? The meat was good, however the portions were rather small. If one combined the size of the steak with the fact that it had not been trimmed for the part that had remained exposed to air in the aging process, which resulted in an unusual taste, one would think that the kitchen had been trying to skimp on everything.Finally, the restaurant was furnished with butcher shop bric-a-brac, but evertyhing was a little dusty and a little dirty, providing the coherent undertone to the style of the house.So, problems with service and with quality. Pity, as the concept behind the restaurant is good and with potential.
1280: Title: Cena dopo la nuova gestione

Review: Da cliente affezionata posso dire che se già prima l'esperienza era degna di nota, ora ancora di più la Macelleria Roberto Costa è la scelta migliore da fare se cerchi ottima carne in un ambiente cozy e informale. Top gli antipasti, over the top il gorgonzola, impagabile la fiorentina. Servizio impeccabile. Consigliatissimo
1281: Review: La verdad es que nos sorprendió mucho! Ibamos sin referencias y sin tener muy claro la carta y la experiencia fue muy buena.El steak tartar buenisimo! Os lo recomiendo! Y el surtido de tartar y embutidos... Uff!!Cuando volvamos a Londres, repetiremos!!!
1282: Review: A great find in South Kensington. Italian steakhouse/butcher. Pick your dinner from dry ages slabs of beef and they custom cut it to your desired size and prepare it in traditional Florentine style. So tender you can cut it with a fork. And tasty/perfectly prepared. We ordered one very large steak and shared it. Suggest you consider the same. Small assortment of homemade pastas available as entrees are good. Moderate sized and reasonably priced wine list with quality all Italian wines. Total price for dinner was reasonable too particularly considering the quality.
1283: Review: We had excellent prime rib, well cooked and tasty. Good atmosphere and service. We will definitely come back for good meat.
1284: Review: Deuxième fois que nous dinons dans ce restaurant, avec la première fois une vrai déception quand au service qui était nul mais la viande était vraiment bonne. Alors on a noté que le nom avait changé, les propriétaires peut être aussi alors nous avons voulu revenir et là super surprise, le service était parfait. Bien que nous ayons attendu un peu la table car les clients précédents ne décollaient pas, ils se sont excusés du retard et nous ont installés le plus rapidement possible en nous offrant une petite assiette de viande séchée. Nous avons commandé un assortiments de petits tartares, nature, herbes et fromage vraiment délicieux et ensuite une énorme cote de boeuf que nous avons partagé. C'était vraiment bon, la viande était tendre et tellement gouteuse. Petit bémol le bruit des conversations plus la musique rendent l'endroit assez bruyant. Le service était rapide et souriant. Bref nous avons passé un très bon moment. C'est un peu cher mais tout est globalement cher à Londres. Un petit clin d'oeil au chef pour la qualité de ses tartares et sa bonne humeur qui sont un vrai plus.
1285: Review: Suggest avoiding Arg Maxela / Macellaio .My girlfriend and I had dinner on August 22nd 2014. We ordered the steak tartare starter. We did not eat our prime rib (cut to order) main course, but took a "doggy" bag.. Nor did we have desert or coffee .We went straight home and both experienced food poisoning symptoms. I have since informed the Food Agency in London (as anyone in this situation should) and the restaurant management (via email). I have not received any response from the restaurant. Obviously, they feel dinning with them is the patron's own gamble. I can only conclude that there has been a lapse in their hygiene as the restaurant prides itself on it meat quality. It wasn't the premium price dinning experience I was expecting.
1286: Review: On our return trip to the proms we again went to visit a restaurant we went to last year only to find the name had changed but the layout ant the general manager was the same we had not made a booking so had a longish wait but it was worth it the food was excellent and the staff could not do enough for us this is a restaurant for the carnivore you would not be disappointed will return next year
1287: Title: Let them give you the works!

Review: Past by this Restraurant yesterday evening & to the wife, "we've got to try that place!" Boy, I'm I glad we did! We are from Texas, we know beef! This is some of the best beef in the world! ell low the butcher took the time to explain the whole process on how they come to searve this carnervers delight. Let them pick the menu, let them pick the wine...sit back, kick back and enjoy...you will not be disappointed. As a matter of fact you. Will probably be motivated to write your first tripadvisor review! Thanks Lellow & staff!
1288: Review: Nella City la carne italiana vince sull'angus!Andiamo spesso a Londra per "carne" ma l'ultima volta siamo stati stregati da una bistecca do 2.2 kg con una frollatura di 6 settimane!Tenera,gustosa con la giusta percentuale di grasso.Per iniziare un tagliere di salumi artigianali italiani ed un prosciutto crudo Campano tagliato a mano!Da allargare la gamma dei Vini, atmosfera piacevole italiana e buon sevizio!
1289: Review: A lovely dinner sublime food and special service (thanks Emma foe everythings) this restaurant is the best ever in London ...A special thanks to Samuele and the Boss
1290: Title: carne salumi e formaggi di qualità
Review: Bella atmosfera e carne eccezionale ,dalla tagliata ai formaggi,personale cordiale pane fatto in casa.I prezzi sono in linea con la qualita' delle portate.consigliatissimo.Paolo
1291: Review: trovandosi a Londra provenendo da Genova non si può mancare l'appuntamento con il Maxelà!! carne strepitosa, tenerissima...pane e focaccia!! salumi ottimi come burrata e stracciatella, dolci buonissimi...personale presente e cortese sempre,che dire? non ho trovato un punto sfavorevole.Il prezzo assolutamnete in linea con la qualità e la provenienza dei prodotti tutti rigorosamente italiani a cominciare dall'acqua (a Londra è imbevibile!!) ah dimenticavo, comodissimo vicino alla stazione della metropolitana south kensington
1292: Title: I want to eat here everyday
Review: Lovely waitress, tasty starter (the cooked meat and cheese board) massive tasty steak, great wine. Shared pudding (the first one on the menu) basically deep fried Nutella.  All very good !!
1293: Review: La carne era di qualità ottima ed anche la presentazione delle portate molto curata. Molto buona l'atmosfera.
1294: Review: Just had an awesome meat feat. There is a menu, but don't bother. Lello put together an awesome selection for up. Delicious food, untouchable beef and awesome staff. Pretty good value. I will definitely be back. Go here now, really worth booking
1295: Review: Sono ritornato in questo ristorante il 11/08/2014 in quanto in precedenza mi ero trovato benissimo e per questo devo ringraziare mia figlia marina e Francesco di Londra Culturale che lavorano a Londra e proprio tramite loro ho conosciuto questo ristorante. Ottima accoglienza di ragazzi preparati sulla cucina e su i vini con ottimi consigli sul menu in cui predomina naturalmente la carne veramente ottima e ben preparata,come ottimi sono gli antipasti ed i dessert. Poi finalmente un ristorante dove troviamo focaccia ed ottimo pane di fattura italiana,specie poi per me che venivo da una esperienza sempre londinese che ho precedentemente recensito di un ristorante rinomato che si fregia dell'italianità e che rimane alle ore 21,00 ora di londra senza"Pane"!!!Bravi mexena..continuate cosi.
1296: Review: I love seeing cured meat exposed before indulging myself in a great meal, I find it so simply Old School!And Lello, the butcher, spent a good patient 15 minutes explaining and giving suggestions, what a great experience and and absolutely fabulous meal, if you like meat of course. Will be back as very soon!!!
1297: Review: Great show and great location, sadly the meat did not really live up to expectations. We shared a Tbone florentina which looked very good. It was the tail end of a side so while we saw the piece we expected that the dried out surface (which is very hard, "dry-burnt" and not edible) would be cut out, but low and behold it was cooked and served! The meat was well cooked and tender but somehow not flavorful enough to make it excellent, which it should be in a meat-dedicated restaurant. The chips were very, very good and the caponata and roast vegetables also good but did not leave us wanting to repeat.
1298: Review: ristorante molto carino, tipicamente italiano! Il personale è giovanile e gentilissimo !! Affettati, Carne e patatine sono OTTIMI!! Unica pecca , è un pó caro..sulle 40-50 sterline a persona!! Ma la cucina e' ottima!! da provare .
1299: Title: Steak at its very best

Review: Format is simple - steaks served in a butchers shop. Looks a bit odd from the outside with a random sofa but don't let it put you off. Small restaurant - about a dozen tables at the back of an italian butchers a couple of minutes from South Ken station. Virtually every dish on the menu is steak with plenty of cuts to choose from. We shared a 1kg tbone which was a fantastic piece of meat perfectly cooked and seasoned.Service was friendly, efficient and helpful. Plenty of red wine to choose from. Busy on a saturday night but we booked on the day. Prices were sensible considering location and quality of the meat. Steaks sold by the kilo but they bring the raw cuts to your table and price each one for you.
1300: Title: Très bonne viande mais service nul

Review: On a l'impression de rentrer dans une boucherie au premier abord car la salle se trouve dans le fond, c'est un concept boucherie + restaurant. La carte est bien évidemment orientée viande rouge, on choisit le morceau que l'on souhaite et le prix s'affiche au kilo, mais attention c'est 700/800 gr minimum donc prévoir d'y aller à plusieurs pour partager. La viande était excellente, la purée en accompagnement délicieuse mais le vrai souci pour moi c'est le service, ils sont nombreux parlent entre eux, dansent meme et le client attend qu'ils aient la gentillesse de prendre la commande et souvent ca dure un moment. C'est relativement cher. Alors ce serait bien qu'ils fassent un vrai effort sur le service car dans le fond il y a d'autres restaurant de viande à Londres qui ont un service plus sympathique.
1301: Title: One of the best steaks

Review: This is a real meat lovers place and much better than allot of steak places around. The meat is allot better than Gaucho but you get a different dining experience here. I love that you get to see the cut that you will eat before its cooked and can choose the weight that you want. Its not as expensive as you might imagine for a steak on the Old Brompton road and the sides are really good. If your looking for a really good steak then I wouldnt look further than here if you are in the South Ken area.
1302: Title: True steak lovers, this one is for you!

Review: Honestly, so far the best and the biggest T-bone steak I've ever tasted anywhere on this planet - including Texas and South America!!They have good selection of Italian wine (mostly vino di tavola), and their carpaccio was superb, too. All is rounded up by very friendly and efficient waitresses. The place looks more like a butcher's store from outside, and tables are lined up in two small rooms that follow. Nothing fancy about decoration, in fact even on the basic side. Warning: place is rather noisy when crowded (and after good vine begins hitting), so this is not the place if lengthy conversation with friends is the objevtive of your evening out.
1303: Title: C'est bon mais c'est cher

Review: Un canapé rouge à l'entrée devant la vitrine.La vitrine remplie de carcasses de viandes prêtent à être découpé.Une vitrine réfrigérée sur la gauche en entrant avec les pièces de viande prêtent aussi à être choisies.On y mange bien, la viande est bonne.Cuisine un peu longue à venir…Service, nombreux mais peu efficace. Sourire un peu forcé.Côte de boeuf sans gros sel d'ailleurs.L'addition est plus salée que les plats…Ca c'est sûr.
1304: Review: This Italian restaurant is really pugliese style...from outside it doesn't t seem a restaurant but a butchery but once inside you discover a small but really nice and welcoming place to eat, at least in my opinion, one of the best steak and tagliata in London. Everything was so tasty and delicious. The staff Is super! Good price for excellent meat!
1305: Review: Senza dubbio originale l'idea e la location, ottimo veloce e cortesissimo il servizio, nulla da dire sulla carne. Dessert da dimenticare e il conto un po' più salato del dovuto.
1306: Title: Great meat & Italian atmosphere - what else do you want?

Review: When we walked by, we immediately got attracted by the mouthwatering meat displayed in the butchers corner right at the beginning of the restaurant. We were lucky and got the last table. The very friendly, all Italian staff recommended great food and drinks (they are all good sellers, as nothing they recommended was on the cheap side). We started with a tartar (which Lello prepared right in front of us) and some slices of lardo - both was excellent and accompanied by great Italian bread. Than we shared a slice of 1 kg dry aged beef, it was one of the best meats I have ever eaten! A delicious bottle of Italian red wine ideally complemented this great dinner experience!
1307: Title: Ristorante dove si apprezza una buona carne

Review: Ho cenato con mia figlia in questo ristorante tipico italiano,proprietari genovesi,specializzato in carne che fa bella mostra di se nella vetrina del negozio. Ottima cucina di carne,ottimo il prosciutto ed i crostini.Un antipasto, un primo e dolce ed un bicchiere di buon vino rosso sino attorno ai 50 puond. allineato ai prezzi di buona ristorazione londinese. Personale gentilissimo.e simpatico. Consigliato...vale una sosta
1308: Title: What you see you get, and it's a lot!

Review: If you're put off by the sight of a real butcher working with real meat that you're going to eat a few minutes later this is not the place for you. If however your mouth starts watering at the spectacle of steak tartare being hand cut/chopped for you in full unadorned view you are in for a treat. Good good ingredients prepared with taste and devotion. Gregarious service and atmosphere in dollops. You will leave satisfied!
1309: Review: It's enough to enter this macelleria style restaurant to understand la voglia..... The senses are excited by the sight and aroma of the meats. Roberto and his team gave my sister an I a most fabulous evening from service, presentation, taste and atmosphere. Am looking forward to returning soon and introducing my friends to this wonderful find.
1310: Review: A culinary experience worth repeating. The waiters are very knowledgeable and can lead to you to the best choices from a menu which is heaven for meat lovers.
1311: Review: Si mangia un ottima carne italiana a Londra e non solo! Una bella sorpresa nel complessa cara..... Bravi comunque
1312: Review: The service, the excellent real Italian quality, and excellent advice you receive are commendable. we had the cured ham board, and ribeye on the bone. The suggested Italian wine was a great choice.
1313: Review: Consigliato da amici siamo andati a cena in questo grazioso ristorante situato in una bella zona di Londra.Avevamo prenotato sapendo che spesso il locale è affollato e consiglio di farlo sempre!La macelleria all'ingresso,tipico timbro della casa, rende subito l'ambiente accogliente.In due con buona bottiglia di vino una fantastica tagliata Gorgonzola e noci, dolci e amari son valsi una 50ina di pound che per Londra è più che in linea ma la qualità si è dimostrata superiore alla media.Il personale gentilissimo, ritorneremo per provare il resto del menù!
1314: Review: First time in London in my life, i was alone and the last night of my work trip i decided to go out for dinner,a collegues seggested me this place for have a good steak! I had the best steak of my life in the best italian atmosphere! The place was so busy (thursday night) and i had sit at the bar where the barman suggested me a perfect glass of white wine with my starter battutta albese with chesee, as a main i had 0.800kg of ribeye dry aged for 5 weeks said me the waiter,was awsome!!! In the meanwhile without ask nothing i had a new glass of wine from the barman red wine,if i'm not wrong was Barolo and i had two of those! No space for dessert but 2 glasses of fantastic grappa barrique!! Amazing place and perfect knowledge of the staff, all the guys and girls were smiling,different style unique place!! I hope to see you soon
1315: Review: The best beef carpaccio ever. You do not even have to add rocca or parmesan. Amazing T-bone and sirloin steaks. My husband and I used to live in London and visit the restaurant once a week. Now that we don't live there anymore we always go there when we are in London for vacation
1316: Review: I am coming to visit this place for the first time on friday at 9pm! we are six people and are excited to see what Maxela holds for us! SO please take care of us!
1317: Title: Nice "macelleria" style in Central London

Review: Had dinner at Maxela with friends and everything was OK the only thing was that the place is actually rather noisy so I will not recommend the place if you have to do a bit of catching up with friends.The meat is very good and my tagliata was perfectly cooked and presented, the red wine to go with it was flowing very easily (maybe too easily but that was our fault!) and the service attentive.I was pleasantly surprised from the bill: in central London there are not many places were you can eat well and healthy with less than 50 pounds....nice!
1318: Title: OUTSTANDING BEEF in a WONDERFUL atmosphere! BooM!

Review: While enjoying a glass of wine in a wine bar 3 doors over from Maxela - the Manager asked us if we had enjoyed any awesome steak while in London? The next thing you know he is walking us in to Maxela & securing a table for us with the Manager. Soon we were enjoying some of the most amazing tartar & cheese! The most wonderful thing about the experience was that we were sitting right next to the butcher who prepared it! He then suggested we enjoy one of their larger cuts of steak which is prepared in an EXTREMELY HOT oven and carved after resting. I also helped him cut our steak - which was pretty cool! Needless to say this delicious beef will MELT in your MOUTH! A very different type of atmosphere but VERY fun! Everyone who works here is also having FUN! If you are in London & want a wonderful piece of BEEF - go to Maxela! BOOM!
1319: Review: Dopo aver scoperto che Maxela vuol dire Macellaio in genovese , ero un po' scettica pensando al classico ristorante italiano a LOndra.Mi sono ricreduta, la carne bionissima , una fiorentina come si deve alta tre dita, cotta alla perfezione.Il personale è gentile, non invadente e avendo avuto modo di parlare proprio con i macellai li abbamo scoperti innamorati del loro lavoro.Ottima la scelta dei vini. Buono il rapporto qualità prezzo.
1320: Title: Best meat in London, very original place

Review: We had a great experience with a friend at Maxela, service was perfect, the meat was incredible: it is aged during 50 days, perfectly cooked. We had the t-bone for 2 and it was already cut, ready to eat for us in a warm plate. We had good wine and good starters too (braseola and tartare). The place is fun : you are in a butchery and they cut the meat just behind you. I will definitely go back with my wife.
1321: Review: It is nigh on impossible to get a good steak in France and so I normally do not eat beef but, as you enter Maxela their display of aged beef decided for me what I was going to choise for dinner. The Costata Maxela was outstanding. It was a busy friday evening when I went and service was chaotic, but the atmosphere was lively and it was all done in the best local Italian way. Very enjoyable.
1322: Title: Stunning fiorentina and excellent service!

Review: Took my boyfriend for a dinner yesterday evening. Been twice to this restaurant, the first time was amazing, the second time I could say even better. On both occasions the Fiorentina was the best I have ever tasted in the UK. High quality meat and very well cooked. The staff are knowledgeable and very friendly. Emma, our waitress was fantastic. I am already looking forward to my next visit!
1323: Title: Maxela:qualità, e originalità "made in Italy"

Review: Consigliati da un mio caro amico DJ, andiamo da Maxela. Personale gentile, locale affollato ma non caotico, ben arredato, con un banco macelleria all'ingresso che ti mette fame solo a guardarlo!Carne di qualità eccellente sia cruda che cotta. Non andresti mai via per come ci si sta bene. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. Ci torneremo sicuramente.
1324: Review: Having visited once before I was impressed with the Tiagliate option on the menu so arranged a family meal on Sunday 4th May with my brother and sister who had flown over from Australia to visit. Whilst not very busy we were crowded into an area with a family including a small child which spent the whole time making so much noise to demand attention we, as a family, could not speak to each other most of the time. The server could not give a toss.Our request for water was met with 2 500ml bottles for the 7 of us and after proceeding to open the wine our server announced that most of the specials where off the menu before he went off to have a dance to the music forced on the diners in the area. After i had sold the various supposed benefits of the menu our server then came over to say that according to the chief 'they were off the menu'. At this point I would have usually got up and left as 'pasta and burger' was not really why we had visited but we pressed on to be ignored by staff who where rude and indifferent with more interesting in 'playing the music loud' for their own benefit that recognising a family get together was being drowned out.At no point was I (or anybody) else approached to see if we where happy and adding a 10% service charge to the bill at the end left me with either creating a scene or just moving on and warning others that complacency has set in, of which I choose the later as whilst hitting the issues head on would have been my preference it would have been unfair to my guests to have been party to quite how I felt about the arrogant, shoddy, indifferent this establishment has shown when it thinks it can get 'anyway' with it.
1325: Title: Italian aged beef's "place to be"

Review: I was looking for a meat place around South Ken. The hotel concierge was right. Maxella is the destination place: Amazing Piemonte aged beef, Receptive butcher, Fresh smoked mozzarella as starter, Round Barolo,Friendly staff. Definitely a good choice in a very competitive/increasingly qualitative London food scene. Enjoy!
1326: Review: My son is a big beef fan. We found this small restaurant in Old Brompton Road and went to try our luck. There is a meat storage fridge, believe it is for aging, at the entrance. My son was excited about it. The restaurant was quite full and we were lucky to be offered a table at the basement which was cosy.The manager, Samuel was helpful in recommending their signature dishes: pesto sauce, beef from Italy..... He was friendly and passionate about what they offered but not pushy at all. We got to pick the dishes we like. We had the homemade pasta with pesto sauce, which was divine. Beef rib was done to perfection, with just olive oil, salt and pepper. We finished 1.2 kg without problem. Side dishes were roasted potato and green salad. The only dish we could not finish was the roast potato as it was big.We surely will return and recommend to our friends. Thumbs up.Overall, very enjoyable and tasty.
1327: Review: This could possibly be the best meat in London, dry-aged to perfection. However it comes with many caveats: there is a limited choice of starters and desserts; no side dishes included. The pieces of meat look huge in the first place but a lot of it is bone and fat. Service is on the pushy side - and not included, making the bill pretty hefty in the end (in excess of £50 per head for a rather basic dinner). There are many possibilities to have more fun and eat well for the same price in London (unless you are craving for meat...)
1328: Review: Premetto che quando vado all'estero mi piace mangiare la cucina locale. Quando vado a Londra, però, assaggio un po' di tutto. E così sono finita al Maxela. Ero un po' scettica, pensavo il solito posto dove la cucina italiana è "finta". E invece mi sono dovuta ricredere. La fiorentina era ottima, con la cottura che avevo chiesto. Prima, però, ci siamo lasciati tentare dalle crocchette cheese & ham e dalla stracciatella, poi abbiamo fatto assaggiare alla coppia di amici inglesi gli gnocchi al pesto e la steak tartare e abbiamo concluso con il latte dolce, che non mangiavo da secoli!!!! Il posto è molto carino e abbastanza intimo. Ci siamo ritrovati su un tavolo a forma di tagliere gigante e c'era il cestino con il pane (ero commossa), che era pure buono (credo lo facciano loro).
1329: Review: Fantastic just that simple, this was a find. Was not really looking to eat but was very intrigued when I walked by... Very glad i did I truly believe best steak in London
1330: Review: Sono stato più volte da Maxela a Genova, è una tappa fissa dopo le mostre al Palazzo Ducale.Durante il recente viaggio a Londra ho deciso di andarci con alcuni amici.Il personale è cortese e tutti sono simpaticissimi. Emma, ai tavoli, è stata professionale e molto gentile, sempre presente senza essere invadente. Lello, dalla cucina, ci ha presentato e consigliato la carne da mangiare e l'ha cucinata in tre modi: al sangue, media e ben cotta. Il tagliere reale (spero di ricordare bene) è imperdibile. Consiglio anche i dolci, per cui esagerate pure con la carne, ma lasciate un angolo per i dolci.Ho trovato eccessivo il costo del vino (Chianti), anche se di buona/ottima qualità.
1331: Review: Steak here is amazing. Good meat and cooked to perfection. Lello took great effort to help us select our dinner and suggest the best way to cook that particular cut of meat. We were offered a delicious canapé too! Steak definitely as good as my other favourite , goodmans, but for way less money.
1332: Title: Verificare bene i prezzi dei vini

Review: Rapporto qualità prezzo nella media tranne per il costo elevato del vino.
Qualità del servizio buono
1333: Title: Conoscere ed integrarsi alla gente del posto, con cibo e vino very good !

Review: Dopo una settimana di camminate non stop, in lungo e largo, per la strepitosa metropoli, non potevamo non cogliere l'occasione di visitare questo particolare locale. Siamo stati accolti con affetto dal gestore genovese e serviti in tempi rapidi dal simpatico e disponibile Vincenzo. Un gruppo giovane di italiani che hanno proposto salumi e carni made in italy. Ci siamo sentiti rilassati ed appagati, ed è stato molto piacevole fare immediatamente amicizia con gli inglesi del tavolo a fianco. Un'ottima occasione per apprendere la convivialità inglese ed il loro entusiasmo nel condividere culture diverse, il tutto degustando buona carne alla griglia (tagliata al momento dal macellaio sotto i nostri occhi) e sorseggiando un buon vino rosso.Roby 73
1334: Review: Ottima cena consumata ieri in questo locale che avevo scoperto grazie alle recensioni su Trip. Bella anche la zona dove si trova, South Kensinghton, a pochi passi da diversi punti d'interesse. Noi dopo un buonissimo tagliere di affettati abbiamo preso una buonissima fiorentina, mio figlio uno squisito filetto, e mia figlia dei buoni tagliolini fatti in casa al pomodoro. La qualità è eccezionale! Il personale è super cortese, noi siamo stati serviti da un ragazzo di Bari del quale non ricordo il nome, davvero bravo e professionale.
1335: Review: Nove amici accolti da amici. Fantastica in sala Emma e Lello in cucina, ottima la carne cucinata come richiesto e dolci spettacolari. In conclusione siamo stati benissimo.
1336: Title: T-bone + Homemade french fries = heaven in the mouth

Review: If you love meat, this restaurant is your paradise. The T-bone steak, doused in a delicious olive oil with rock salt, is incredible. The atmosphere is very friendly and the service is good. The only negative point is that it is too noisy …
1337: Review: Simply best meat and great service. Highly recommend to visit if you are near the area! You will be surprised just like I was. The staff are very friendly which makes you feel more welcomed. Grazie mille and see you very soon!! Definitely will be back
1338: Title: Good Food but the service is irritating

Review: Maxela is impressive: good quality meat cuts are served; portions are good. Unpretentious It can be compared with equivalent steak houses in places like New York or Latin Amerika. The places is rather small, tables are not so closed to each other. The service is however needs a lot of improvement: waiters are quite casual and do not know how to set up a table or serve in an effective way. They do forget one thing or another and make you wait. Nonetheless they have good manners. Raw meat cuts and rib eye steak was indeed nice. Wines are somewhat expensive.Recommended.
1339: Title: Probably the best meat in town
Review: A nice place where you can probably taste the best meat in London. The Fiorentina is just superb. Good service.
1340: Review: I have been to Maxela three times. The first two times I had really positive food experiences. My third visit was an extreme disappointment. The first bad sign was when my wife called to request a table in the back, where it is 'less' noisy. On the phone the young man gave her a bit of hassle then told that Maxela is not the 'Cipriani' and that she should expect some noise. At dinner, the waiter was not very attentive, we waited an extremely long time, for the main course to arrive (50min or more) even though we were fairly early seated in the evening. When my dish came I had to send it back; the meat was incredibly tough and difficult to cut with the very sharp steak knife, furthermore it was cold. I have never sent food back before. Ever! I never thought that I would receive cold tough meat from a meat specialist, from Piemonte? I am an Italophile when it comes to food, I found the lack of consistency a huge disappointment! Furthermore the waiter was quite unprofessional, he seemed personally annoyed that I sent the dish back, and afterwards he seemed to make himself even less available to us than previously. He did kindly accept our tip for his bad service. When the bill came he kindly explained that we did not pay for the dish that I sent back (the one I did not eat nor reordered). He explained that could not reprint a receipt because there was no manager on duty, therefore he crossed out the costs on the receipt with a ball point pen. I thought he was really taking a liberty, and he dis not leave me any incentive to come again. So much for repeat business.I would say that all of the unprofessional horse play by the staff leaves one cold. I do not come to listen to the staff's bad music selections or watch them horse around with their mates, I am there for the food and to chat with My friends. When the wait staff act like they are the ones on show I believe this restaurant will be there a only short while. I can honestly say the staff would never behave like this if they were in Italy!!I will not return, nor recommend it to friends, although they may have a good experience, they may not...and well London is full of reliably good places to go time after time, where one is treated well.
1341: Review: I was very spoilt on a recent trip to New York steak restauraunt wise. As much as I liked one particular restauraunt, this place is AMAZING. Yes the seating is a little snug, but the atmosphere is great and the food really is amazing. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and was able to recommend an amazing meal.The whole meal was amazing from start to finish. The only thing I didn't really like was the fact that people were hovering over me with a drink waiting for a table yowards the end. However, I would definitely go again.
1342: Review: Sono venuta giusto in Ottobre 2012 quando l'hanno inaugurato, sapendo ovviamente dell'evento e già subito era pieno. Frequento il Maxela di Genova e a Londra ho respirato la stessa atmosfera sia per le carni, sia per il personale, sia per l'atmosfera.
1343: Title: The best steak in London

Review: This is a foodies restaurant, not a pretentious dining experience. The steaks are superb. That might sound unlikely but they source them from specialist suppliers and cook them to perfection.However, the nicest surprise is the care they put into the choice of other ingredients, from quality breads, to cheeses, deserts and coffee. Don't expect white table cloths or smart porcelain but if you enjoy going to places where people are passionate about food then it's certainly worth a visit. It's not cheap but it's worth the experience.
1344: Review: We went there for the second time and weren't disappointed from the steak and the starters. Meat was tender the carpaccio amazing the board of charcuterie soo so good. The only thing that let's this place down is the service. It's not just quite there yet. For the prices you pay you would expect a bit more professionalism and at least a smile. All in all we paid £220 for two people, one bottle of wine and one dessert. Yes the meat is high quality and well cooked but the feeling you get is that you are there just eat quickly, pay the bill and leave.
1345: Title: Best steak I've ever eaten

Review: I came here last week for my birthday meal, having been here before with some colleagues, and both times the steak was consistently AMAZING. The flavour was just out of this world, it was cooked perfectly and was so juicy and tender. T-bone steak highly recommended! They also gave us a glass of prosecco and some salami on the house as they knew it was my birthday, which was really lovely.The service was great, and it feels like a relaxed, authentic Italian trattoria. If you want stuffy michelin starred service then it's not really that style but that's fine with me! The meal was fairly pricey but you totally get what you pay for, which is high quality ingredients that only need simple cooking and speak for themselves.
1346: Title: La fassona in trasferta a Londra

Review: Ottimo ristorante.Non è facile mangiare un'ottima bistecca (di carne bovina Fassona) come questa in Italia, figuriamoci a Londra.Il locale è ben tenuto, il servizio è ottimo e la competenza del personale è sicura, perchè ti sanno consigliare bene sia sul tipo di carne adatto ai gusti, che un neofita della bistecca può non sapere, sia sulla cottura.La carne è ben frollata, morbida e succosa, da richiedere come tagliata o come vera e propria bistecca. Ottimi anche i contorni.La cosa che sicuramente pesa, ma a Londra è la prassi, è il prezzo piuttosto elevato: ciononostante vale ciò che si paga.
1347: Review: A place that wants to be reknown for meat ahould know how to cook and serve a T-bone. We ordered a medium-rare T-bone and got a raw piece of meat still blue and cold inside. We complain and send it back, but instead of re-doing it from scratch the kitchen decided to re- cook the already sliced meat to well done. We received no discount and got the lamest excuse "sorry, it was the apprentice chef cooking it".Seriously, that left us speechless. Never again, ever. If you want good meat brautifully cooked avoid this place.
1348: Review: Really enjoyed it here, attentive staff who helped me with my gluten free needs. Fantastic steak too!!
1349: Review: Ottimo ristorante, piccolo ma molto accogliente e originale (consiglio la prenotazione)Ottima fiorentina e ottimo vino!Vincenzo, uno dei camerieri è stato molto gentile ed educato.Consiglio a tutti coloro che vivono o passano per londra a fermarsi al Maxela!
1350: Title: One of the best steaks in London

Review: Some of the best steak I've had this side of the Atlantic. My wife and I go here at least once every two weeks and the food and service are consistently fantastic. Vincenzo, our waiter tonight, was incredibly helpful and attentive. We love choosing our steaks at the butcher counter and we love the relaxed atmosphere. As far as we are concerned there is only Hawksmoor and Maxela. Everything else is just background noise.
1351: Title: Best meat in town and great atmosphere

Review: I've been here in different occasions, with all sort of friends and everyone always agreed: this place has the best meat ever! Staff is incredibly nice and helpful. Alessio, the guy in charge of the meat cutters, was so knowledgeable as crazy! Every single one of their dishes is an explosion of flavors. Desserts are fantastic and wine as well is a real treat.This place isn't cheap, but is extremely right price for what you get. Everything is super good quality and will never be able to complaint about food itself. Booking is probably advised, especially on weekends, as the place can get filled up easily. Walking distance from South-Kensington Underground Station, so it's very easy to get there.
1352: Title: L'accoglienza di Emanuele e desiree non ha prezzo

Review: Consigliato da mia cugina guendalina che lavora nel locale poco distante eclipse. Cena perfetta. Cibo impeccabile. L'Italia a Londra. Desiree ed Emanuele ci hanno fatto sentire a casa. Persone fantastiche. La prossima volta a Londra sar\'e0 la prima scelta per mangiare. Grazie }
1353: Title: La carne italiana a londra !

Review: Locale esclusivamente da carnivori ! Quando entri il profumo della carne e inebriante ti avvolge e chi ci è stato mi può capire. Il locale nel complesso e in stile maxela ,ma si avverte la " mano " di roby costa ,le frollature sono perfette lo stile dei piatti e decisamente il suo , e il fassone piemontese così lavorato lo a portato a vincere 10 a 0 contro la carne dell angus inglese .....bravi tutti !Assolutissimamente consigliato se passate da londra .Ps se volete una scaloppina cambiate locale !
1354: Title: Best Beef ever with the exception of one staff with horrible service

Review: It was the last day of my trip to Europe and I decided to try out Maxela which was recommended by a blogger. The atmosphere inside was nice and we were serviced nicely at first by a young gentlemen. We didn't book a table so we were given two choices, either sit at a nice table for two, but give the table back after one hour, or, sit at the bar table and we could stay however long we wanted. So we chose the bar table. The butcher ( who was also the cook) recommended some amazingly nice dishes (beef tartare) and cooked the beef to perfection! He was also talkative and we enjoyed our dinner with his company. HOWEVER, We ordered red wine ( with the meat. DUH) but was given white wine. When we told the female staff who we actually wanted red, she rolled her eyes with a ' wat the fxxx' face and just walked away rudely.
