LASTLY ( the WORST part of our dinner), when my friend requested for the bill, the female staff ( wasn't in uniform. and at times walked around to check on every table and offered only SOME tables bread, i wonder why?? discrimination against looks? clothing? age?? race??) asked her a question with a strong italian accent but my friend couldn't hear her ( cuz it was noisy in the restaurant) after she repeated it for two times, she simply rolled her eyes and waived her hands rudely and walked away with this ' oh my god, why are these people here, let me just get the bill so they can leave FASTER' expression. So overall, the food was really good, but the restaurant could be better without this horrible woman who doesn't understand the basics of SERVICE.
1355: Title: Favoloso sotto tutti i punti di vista!!!

Review: La carne è veramente ottima, forse la migliore che io abbia mangiato, compresa quella dello stesso ristorante a Genova.L'ambiente è molto accogliente e pulito.il personale è cortesissimo ed efficientissimo.Da non perdere!!!
1356: Title: Good idea but overall bad experience - not recommended

Review: I have been to Maxela a couple of times. The first time I was not impressed however I went back last week because friends booked there..The idea behind the restaurant (the butcher that sells and cooks the meat) is not bad but the implementation is poor.Food : the quality of the meat is very good however once again the "tagliata" arrived at our table after a long wait and it was warmish. This is a huge mistake and it is not a coincidence because happened twice in 2 months. In Italy the "tagliata" is served in dishes that are boiling hot in order to preserve the temperature of the meat. This guys don't know the basic rules of cooking and serving meat.The presentation was also very poor, the meat comes without any side in an empty(cold) dish. Put some salad, or potatos, or something.Service: The service is very bad - either they come 3 times to ask you the same thingh or they just ignore you. Also the Chef should stay in the kitchen instead of walking around the tables and chat with everyone. He came to out table and took our orders, he wan't even listening to us and he didn't write anything. Of course the order was wrong and we didnt get what we ordered.The athmosphere is lively and informal, however the croud was not right. A lot of people shouting, bad and loud music.Price : being ion South Ken doesn't justify the high price if you don't deliver. Overpriced food & wine
1357: Title: A real find in South Kensington

Review: Recommended by an Italian friend who said Maxela opening in London stopped him returning to Rome so frustrated was he by the lack of good beef in London. With so many London establishments presenting themselves as steak restaurants Maxela leaves them standing not only on the quality of the beef - all from Italy, aged and from the sweeter grass fed meat of heffers - but also in how it is cooked in their 400 degree specially made ovens. Leelo, their Neapolitan in house butcher, presides behind his counter of magnificent & huge cuts of beef. He happily and knowledgeably talks you through them all & made good recommendations. A great education. The aged rib eye was cooked perfectly with simply rock salt and oil and was incredibly tender with terrific flavour. This followed the Tagliere Imperiale (a sharing butcher's board of salami, lardo, bresaola and two steak tartares and Burrata cheese). The wine suggested was very good. There was little room for side orders of vegetables - I would suggest just a green salad as the emphasis is on the generous servings if beef. We did not have pudding as there was no room for it and the selection was surprisingly limited. Definitely a great place to go if you want superb beef in a lively but naturally enthusiastic Italian setting. Roberto the owner has a hands on approach and the staff were all helpful and efficient. It is a third visit and a great local favourite now.
1358: Review: Un buonissimo ristorante tutto italiano nel cuore di Londra. Carni, salumi e formaggi da provare! Personale carino, pulito e elegante, con una gradevole nota veneta!Coozy al punto giusto.
1359: Review: If you like meat then this is the place for you. Ask for Lello and he will pick you the perfect steak from the butcher's counter at the front. Very authentic and lots of fun.
1360: Title: Superb food, good atmosphere - a neighbourhood gem

Review: Almost everything was very good, the bread -a salty, dense brioche - the ham and burrata, the tagliatta steaks and the red wine we had - fresh and young, was a good surprise for £22. I thought the sides (roasted potatoes and side salad) at £4 each were a bit pricey and small and the potatoes a bit on the dry / overvooked side. The steaks were a bit on the small side but turned out to be enough. Great service, lovely decor, warm atmosphere. Perfect for a neighborhood meal when looking for warm, robust, flavorsome food for a cold winter night.
1361: Review: Siamo capitati per caso in questo ristorante senza sapere che fosse italiano! Atmosfera cordiale e accogliente il personale molto cortese e amichevole. Abbiamo mangiato dell'ottima carne: ho ordinato una bistecca al rosmarino e ho potuto assaporare il semplice genuino sapore della carne, mio marito ha mangiato la costata...divina! Ottimi anche il pane che, se non ho capito male, è fatto da loro e la selezione di vini. Per chiudere la cena abbiamo fatto una piacevole chiacchierata con il giovane chef Matteo. Se passate per Londra ve lo consiglio! Sono anche a roma Genova e altre città italiane.
1362: Review: Great food in good price. We had tagliatta and costata. Both were very good and very well cooked. We had 2 glasses of a full body red wine that proposed us Lello the chef. Very good. The desert was not as good as the food. Next time I'll try tiramisu.Excellent choice
1363: Title: Carne freschissima e ben cucinata

Review: Di solito non amo mangiare italiano quando sono all'estero. Ma in questo caso, si trattava di una cena programmata per lavoro e sono rimasta molto soddisfatta di avere avuto l'occasione di provare questo ristorante, che per fortuna si trova anche in diverse città d'Italia, tra cui la mia, Genova. La carne è cucinata molto bene, gli antipasti (carne, salumi e latticini) sono ottimi e freschissimi. Anche l'ambiente è molto accogliente, con tavoli di legno e luci soffuse. Personale italianissimo, gentile e disponibile. Consigliato!
1364: Title: Atmosfera italiana e ottimo cibo

Review: Sono stata in questo ristorante qualche giorno fa per il compleanno del mio ragazzo. Ho voluto regalargli questo "pezzo d'Italia" a Londra viste anche le ottime recensioni qui su TripAdvisor. Devo dire che le aspettative non sono state tradite, anzi. Abbiamo cominciato con un ottimo antipasto a base di stracciatella e misto di salumi (lardo, bresaola e salame con bruschette condite con verdure grigliate). Vivendo da qualche mese in UK, assaggiare di nuovo prodotti tipici italiani italiani (e non il solito falsume inglese) è stato magnifico, il tutto aiutato dalla gentilezza nel consigliarci di Emanuele. Abbiamo preso poi due tagliate, una con lardo e sauté di cipolle e un'altra con gorgonzola e noci. Piccolo appunto su quest'ultima, forse un po' troppo gorgonzola che magari può infastidire chi non è abituato a questi sapori.Per completare, avevo inviato nelle note della prenotazione una richiesta: fetta di torta con candelina per festeggiare il compleanno del mio ragazzo. Sono stata accontentata e devo dire che questa accortezza è stata la ciliegina sulla torta. Ci tornerò sicuramente, se non altro per sentirmi di nuovo a casa "culinariamente" una volta ogni tanto.
1365: Review: i Had a wonderful food and a red italian wine at maxela , the venue was very close to my hotel and the service was quick and efficient with just the right ambiance . My steak was well cooked and not hard but just perfect and to accompany it was a mixture of vegetables on the side. I highly recommend it whenever you are in south kensington.
1366: Review: If you are from Tuscany, missing the food and want a properly cooked fiorentina made with chianina steak, go here. Unique.
1367: Review: This place is incredible. I had florentine steaks once in Italy and have loved them since. The old style florentine steaks here are delicious and for London not terribly expensive. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is also very good. It's great for groups of friends as well as for dates Or lunch.
1368: Title: Very average food horrible service
Review: If you want to pay a big premium for your very average food and want to wait 2hrs for your food dealing with very impolite staff this is your (un)lucky place. Horrible.
1369: Review: Maxela goes back to the roots of food. Since you see it from the window - it looks like a aimle butcher from outside- you have the feeling that you are stepping into another world. Lello, the butcher, and the warm and friendly staff will welcome you for the best Italian steak house in town. Not to be missed: strawberry&chilli tartare, zola&pear burger and... Tiramisu. They will see you back at least a second time!
1370: Review: While meandering we found this gem for a late lunch.Exquisitely prepared... proudly presented...delicious meat. We enjoyed a "tagliere" from the starter menus that include battuta, steak tartare, carpaccio, fresh mozzarella and more...added a side salad and an order of Cannelloni beans ... more than enough for the 2 of us,. Yet we managed to finish every bite ...loved the wine too. Service by Manuel was excellent, attentive and thoughtful. We felt like we were back in a small town in Italy, sampling the best meats, cheese and hospitality
1371: Review: I've heard a lot about this place from my friends so i decided to give it a go. BEST meat i've had in London.Steak Tartare is an absolute must if you like it and the steak was absolutely divine. Will definitely be coming back and recommending this to everyone i know!Big thanks to Lello for being such a great chef!
1372: Review: We visited Maxela during a recent trip to London!  The steak we had was so tender and tasty!  A great atmosphere and friendly service! A great place to go with friends for a fun night out!
1373: Review: I've been yesterday at Maxela with my boyfriend and 2 friends, as usual we had great time. The food was amazing, the meat delicious :D the best meat you can have in town!!! A suggestion for everyone don't have a look at the menu, let the staff suggest you :p Lovely staff and a special thanks to the Great Lello for look after us so well. Thanks a lot guys!
1374: Review: Just back home after a fun night with dear old friends in this casual fun restaurant in South Kensington. The food is fantastic, delicious gnocchi with pesto and the meat is the best in London. We had the luck to be sitting near the butcher chef Lello and see how skilled he is with the meat preparation. He let us try his secret recipe battuta al gorgonzola...original tartare recipe and explained the secrets of meat preparation. We cannot wait to go back and taste something else prepared by Lello. Highly recommend to visit!
1375: Review: Great dinner! Lively environment. Great food - the gnocchi were excellent. The meat was even better and the meat chef Lello was extremely friendly and helpful in helping us choose the meat and took time during our dinner to explain all of the different cuts. Staff were very friendly.
1376: Title: Special thank you to Lello

Review: The cheaf butcher,name Lello, recommand the Tbone with grill vegetables and garlic rosemary olive oil sauce on side... just outstanding ;) thank you for your advice : top of the world for people who enjoy nice grill meat. I'll be back Lello. Hope to meet you again. Tom
1377: Review: Fall in love with meat again and feel, taste and sense the true meaning of meat in a pure authentic Italian way. The guys working there were magnificent, friendly and lovers of food. Was great to chat and learn about the food and where it came from . Could not recommend this pla e highly enough.
1378: Review: There are many good steak houses in London but Maxela definitely offer something more.You can pick your very own cut (they will cut it in front of you) from the butcher counter, Lello will help you to chose the best part according to your taste and I my very own case he never missed a shot.I would recommend this place to all the meat lovers which are tired to pick from a board and want to have a real experience.
1379: Title: Warm, welcoming and wonderful food....!

Review: First visit based on a recommendation and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome. Lello the butcher explained the various cuts of beef and helped us select a beautiful t bone to share.Our waitress Giorgia was equally friendly and talked at length about the restaurant concept and the ethos behind Maxela.In summary excellent food and fantastic service. Thank you, we will be sure to visit again.
1380: Review: This seemed to me the authentic taste of Italy, along with authentic Italian personnel. The presence of a butcher's shop in this small restaurant seemed strange, but somehow reassuring of quality. I had Tagliata with Canneloni (I'm avoiding carbs, where possible) and it was delicious! It went well with a rather lovely Chianti. Not cheap, but good for an occasional visit.
1381: Review: Jantei no Maxela. Da rua se vê uma vitrine com carnes penduradas, parecendo um açougue. Para desavisados, assusta. Logo na entrada um balcão com as carnes e o açogueiro. Pedi um hamburguer com gorgonzola. estava muito bom. Feito na ponta da faca, e não moído. Carne bem alta, no ponto solicitado. Valeu!
1382: Title: One of the best steakhouses in London

Review: Simple, casual and straight to the point; that's how I would describe this hidden gem in South Kensington.Upon entering you may easily think you've entered a butcher shop but soon you will be escorted inside where a small and cosy room with well spaced tables awaits. Excellent starters, I recommend the Battuta and Steak Tartare; marinated in olive oil, they feel as pure and tasty as anything that I ve tried recently.For main, I would suggest the Costata (ribeye steak), although it would be a good idea to ask the staff for what they would suggest on the day.Only very small negative point I would make is that the quality of the meat we ordered was slightly variable in a few cases; sometimes better that other times.Thoroughly recommend a visit!
1383: Review: Outstanding service. Great place and environment. Good quality (although not the best I've tried). Not particulary overpriced for London. Good place for a calmed dinner
1384: Review: I have been to Maxela 5 times and it never disappointed me! It is by far one of the best steak restaurants in London. I suggest to book the table as they are usually quite busy even during the week. Service was great, the owner often comes to the tables to explain the differences among meat cuts and he is always happy to suggest best plates according to individual preferences.Suggested plates: Tagliere Misto (starter), Fiorentina Maxela and Costata Maxela (main), Caponata (side), Latte dolce fritto and Torta al cioccolato (dessert).
1385: Title: A restaurant with a lot of enthusiasm behind it

Review: We visited Maxela in July on a Monday, lunch time. We had Roberto to choose for us: bresaola di fassone for starter and tagliata for main. Both were presented and cooked to perfection. The staff and the owner were genuinely interested to hear opinion of the food. Maxela is an absolute dream for meat lovers and the particular aspect of it is that it serves very tender meat (Fassone beef) from Northern Italy. It was very stimulating to see an Italian restaurant that specialises in a less known aspect of Italian food instead of serving the usual pasta. The bread was obviously home baked and delicious. Very good wine list designed to complement the food. The tiramisu was nice in both presentation and taste, although the coffee taste could have been a bit stronger.Maxela is clearly a restaurant and a very special butchery I will be happy to return to.
1386: Title: Ottima carne italiana a Londra

Review: Mi sono concesso questa abbuffata di carne come premio dopo la mia 1/2 Maratona di Londra. Location suggestiva con banco delle carni a vista dietro al quale si muove con insuperabile maestria lo chef ( quasi un chirurgo) deputato al taglio per la preparazione delle diverse comande. Dopo un antipasto di bresaola di qualità eccelsa, una gustosa tartar di manzo ed un assaggio di prosciutto e mozzarella di bufala assolutamente non banale, ma al contrario di forte personalità, mia moglie ed io abbiamo optato per una costata di fassona di squisito sapore, incredibilmente tenera di circa 1,2 Kg. Servizio attento e particolarmente gentile. Indirizzo da non mancare durante un soggiorno a Londra, pregevole mix di ottima materia prima e buona cucina del Bel Paese.
1387: Review: An attractive restaurant with a warm welcoming staff...the food was awesome nd the staff did everything that was in their power to make us enjoy the meal!! nd they succededit was from far one of the best meal i have ever had nd one of the best welcoming. One of the Staff Even offered us a little french conversation ( we are french)Visited on september 23rd.
1388: Review: For the location in South Kensington the standar of the service should have been at least average, I have found the welkome not friendly and polite. As a old customer from Genoa, I can tell that something is different and missing!!! The place was close and some of the staff smoking out side have suggested us to come back in a hour that it was not a problem. After an hour we came back to the place and we have been rejected again (after they suggested to come in an hour) in not at all polite way. The place was empty, the staff was sat down chatting and playing. The host just said 'no' without thinking abou a solution to put us at the bar or inviting to come further later.Big shame the food is great as I know, the staff recruited not as great.
1389: Title: Un pezzo d'Italia a Londra..

Review: Siamo andati al maxela consigliati da un'amico,siamo rimasti estremamente soddisfatti dall'atmosfera del locala e dalla squisita carne!lo staff completamente italiano è stato magnifico!una serata magnifica!Lo consiglio a tutti gli italiani che vogliono mangiare sano e buono a Londra!la carne lo ripeto era ottima!complimenti al maxela!
1390: Review: Easily the best meal out I've had in London. Excellent food, nice selection of wines and brilliant service. Our waiter was great - he even joined us for a limoncello! Thank you all for a truly fantastic night.
1391: Review: Nos prepararon un chuletón a la parrilla y acompañamiento buenísimos. Los postres también espectaculares y el servicio muy amable y atentos.
1392: Review: Having made an impromptu booking; we arrived to see the restaurant brimming with life and mostly Italian patrons. Whilst waiting to be seated sampled some terrific aged bresaola at the meat counter. We were seated at an excellent table. Samvele (ex Apsley) had appreciated that the usual places we dine for steak are H & G. The rib eye was outstanding. The courtesy and hospitality extended by the team was exemplary. We will be returning again and again.......
1393: Review: Helpful owner, who takes time to explain meat cuts, and about aging the meat. My husband and a friend shared a cut of meat and were raving about it. Another friend and I had the home-made pasta, with pesto and a couple of vegetable dishes. their homemade bread is a must to try. Everything was tasty, well presented, served with a smile and a sense of humour. We liked this place. We were made to feel at home, the food was authentic and we will definitely go back when in London.
1394: Title: E pensare che sono scettica ai ristoranti italiani all'estero...

Review: Una carissima amica che abita a Londra mi propone questo locale per la cena.. pronunciato da lei sembrava quasi un locale arabo, in cui avremmo dovuto mangiare italiano, e mangiar bene! Il mio ragazzo ed io accettiamo e fin dall'ingresso nel ristorante l'atmosfera e i ragazzi dello staff si rivelano allegri e accoglienti. Il banco della macelleria è proprio di fronte al nostro tavolo e questo ci permette di osservare la preparazione dei piatti e percepire la passione con la quale questi ragazzi servono i loro prodotti. Abbiamo mangiato un antipasto chiamato Il piatto del re, composto da ottimi salumi, burrata e battuto di carne cruda, di-vi-no. Ci hanno poi consigliato una fiorentina di Fassona: la cottura al sangue era perfetta e la carne si scioglieva in bocca.. come nei migliori ristoranti del nostro paese!! Il tutto naturalmente accompagnato da ottimo vino rosso italiano..Italiani che vivete lì o che passate per viaggio o lavoro, vi consiglio di prenotare una cenetta in questo locale (prenotazione anche on line). Il costo, non è proprio a buon mercato, ma vale assolutamente la serata!!
1395: Review: Sono spesso all'estero per lavoro e di solito preferisco mangiare la cucina locale. Spesso però mi trattengo qualche settimana e qualche volta una cena italica non mi dispiace. A Londra c'è una vastissima scelta ma spesso i piatti sono "anglosassonizzati" (scusate il termine). Con piacere mi sono imbattuto in questo ristorante e ho avuto modo passando di parlare con i proprietari(due simpatici genovesi) che mi hanno convinto a rimanere a cena. E' stata una bellissima esperienza a base di carne di fassone piemontese. Non conoscevo questo ristorante, che poi ho saputo è presente in varie città italiane, ma adesso lo considero una ottima integrazione alla mia dieta londinese. Vale la pena provare.
1396: Review: We visited after the Proms and was made most welcome if you are a carnivore this is most definitly the place to go I went with my grandson and family a great grandson of nine was made most welcome the butchers Matteo and Alessio were brilliant with hime along with the attention paid to us all with Giorgia our waitress and the Manager Samvele who was most helpful with the wine selection good food good service and great atmosphere agreat ending to a wonderful day
1397: Review: Siamo andati a cena mandati da un nostro caro amico ke a sua volta è amico del proprietario anzi cogliamo l occasione x salutarlo CIAO ROBY!!! Abbiamo mangiato alla grande c ha consigliato tutto Samuele simpaticissimo anke lui e molto professionale... Carne ottima ragazzi sembra d stare in Italia! Se passate da Londra andateci e sentirete ke bontà!!! Nessuna critica!!! Bravi ragazzi! Cosimo e stefania
1398: Review: Situato in South Kensinghton il ristorante della catena Maxelà rispetta tutte le promesse che da anni la rende famosa. Trovato per caso non ce lo siamo lasciati sfuggire ed è stato davvero come cenare in Italia. Ottima la carne, gli antipasti, i dolci. Presentati con cura e soprattutto cordialità ed efficienza dal personale tutto italiano, giovane e gentile. Un buon modo per fare conoscere all'estero la nostra ottima cucina e la nostra cordialità. Non perdetelo se siete a Londra ed avete voglia di buon cibo.
1399: Review: Best dining experience in South Kensington. Amazing atmosphere and knowledgable staff! Roberto is simply great! The gnocchi al pesto are definitely the best in London and all my friends cannot get enough of their meat! Great place that I would recommend to everyone ! I will definitely continue to go there every week!
1400: Review: You know what you're getting as soon as you see this restaurant - it resembles a butcher's shop from the outside and when you enter. A butcher that has some of the biggest slabs of meat you'll ever see!But fear not, it is much more pleasant to eat in than that sounds, although they could do with some decent air conditioning in the back in summer.The food is very impressive and everything I had was excellent. The food has an Italian theme but is not exclusively so (the steak tartare, for example, which was very good). Service was excellent, led by an outstanding maître d' who was professional, friendly and full of good advice all at the same time.Good Italian wine list too, including some nice choices by the glass.
1401: Title: To meat or not to meat?!? Def to meat!

Review: Lovely steak tartare! Maybe avocado could be added
Bread should always come with the meal ... Italian style
Loved the bottle-glasses
TableService could be more attentive, but still good; young gentleman at the butcher till was v friendly,talkative and inspiring
1402: Review: Excellent idea to open a restaurant in a butcher's shop and although my final vote is average I hope that the staff will make a little more effort and become very good. As I am very fond of meat and I like it cooked 'blue' it is sad when it arrives overcooked as it means that either the waiter did not inform the chef or the chef decided it needed to be cooked more. The redeeming feature was that the replacement T-bone was truly excellect and just as we wanted it. Look forward to returning and hope to give it a better score.
1403: Review: italiani davvero carne fassone piemontese vini di qualita' con maccelleria all'interno personale giovane e molto cordiale ottimi anche i contorni e dolci se andate a londra e avete voglia di mangiare bene andateci
1404: Title: Finally, good steak in London

Review: stumbled into the restaurant totally by chance and what luck. I have two young girls who ordered pasta, as usual when going to Italian restaurant but once they had a bite of my steak, they couldn't stop. The meat is amazing and you get to choose your own cut from the butchery in the front of the restaurant. The staff are friendly and very welcoming, which made leaving at the end of the meal even harder. The menu and the wines are top notch and I would recommend you visit on your own, as a family or even on business. Well done!! Finally, top quality with a difference.
1405: Review: Walked passed several times thought it was a butcher, then realized it's a restaurant. What a surprise! Service is friendly, steak is out standing. and the Tiramisu is really to die for. I thought I make good tiramisu, but this supposedly "mom's recipe" was one of the best we've tasted. My son ordered a pasta dish, we thought it was great as well, al dente and very tasty. Wish could go back again before we leave
1406: Title: Yes the best steak ever, service could be a bit more attentive

Review: If you are a meat lover, this is the place to be, no doubt.A butchery with some tables and a bar, some more tables at the back and downstairs.Run by Italians and visited by many Italian people, at least when I was there.Serious craftsmanship, proud people and matured beef minimum 25 days hung.I just had to try this place.I had to wait a bit before someone came to get the order, which could be a bit faster, but at least had some time to watch the butcher prepare and cut the meat (and take some pictures of it...).Ordered some cured meat Bresaola di Fassone with roquet to start and a Filetto di Fassone cooked medium rare for main. Some hand cut chips as side.The cured meat was nice, but the best steak I ever ever had, was the Filetto. Amazing top quality and cooked right with some rock salt and served on top of some fresh rosemary branches...The fries were a bit so so. Next time will try the Cannelli beans.Forget the famous expensive steak houses. This is the place I will return to when around again. Hope the service will improve and become a bit more attentive.
1407: Title: Food was OK but service terrible

Review: Went there on a weekday night. We had no reservation but asked to return in 40 min. When we did we were told that no table was or would be available. When we asked the manager miraculously a table was found immediately and there were two more tables vacant so obviously the first person lied to us (he probably wanted to leave early). Food was OK but service slow and was even called mate by one of the waiters - do not expect this in a £30/p restaurant. Really disappointed and will certainly not return. Refused of course to pay the service charge and explained fully the situation only to be offered inadequate excuses.
1408: Review: Ero in vacanza a Londra e cercavamo un buon ristorante, così chiamo il mio ex compagno di classe che non lavorava più lì ma che mi ha consigliato al 100%. Dall'esterno potrebbe sembrare una macelleria, ma vi assicuro che l'atmosfera e lo stile all'interno merita molto, il locale è pulito e ben curato, il cibo è di altissima qualità. Il pane fatto da loro è buonissimo così come la pasta e gli gnocchi: tutto fatto a mano, l'olio extravergine di oliva e aceto balsamico invecchiato sono tra i migliori ed usano prodotti italiani. Ho preso una tagliata di manzo, la cottura era perfetta, la carne morbida e saporita, potete anche scegliervi il pezzo di carne che vorreste mangiare. Non è eccessivamente caro, giusto un po' sopra la media, non aspettatevi grandi porzioni ma è il posto ideale per un'ottima cena e vale i soldi spesi, è come cenare nei bei tempi passati. Prima di andarci, prenotate. Difficilmente rimarrete delusi!
1409: Title: Meat , meat meat and meat ok to meet

Review: We had to wait for our table in front of the butcher therefore we had enôugh time to pick the piece we wanted ... Once we had spotted the oldest piece , the italian young butcher decided we were worth talking to...the origin of the meat is top, the conservation ultimate, the variety extreme, the taste amazing... We loved it, the personnel is friendly and helpfull it is a small communityofitalians whi definetely know about MEAT...
1410: Title: Great food, unfortunately terrible service

Review: Went there with a couple of friends and the food was great but unfortunately the service seriously let it down especially from the manager. We had ordered a separate side dish to our meat, however they served us the meat without the side dish. We asked the waiter about our side dish and he advised us that it was on its way. We waited for a while but started eating the meat because it was getting cold. We asked for it againa and we eventually asked the waiter to cancel our side dish and he was fine about it however about five minute later (when we had finished all our dishes) the manager comes and serves us the side order. We advise him that we had cancelled the order as we had waited for a while and had finsihed our meal. His reaction was certainly not what we expected from a grown man. He went on to kick the floor board and stormed off, as if we had committed a crime.... very strange. We were quite shocked to say the least. We tried to explain our disappointment to no avail. Unfortunately because of this incident the evening was somewhat tainted especially as the final bill was just over £200.00 so we would expect some level of service for this level of restaurant. We didnt have any apologies which would have certainly made everything better. Some may say that the service is less important however for me and my friends it is an important part to our experience. Needless to say, we wont be going back which is a shame as the meat was really good.
1411: Review: had dinner here last night - the food is really great and the staff make it a great place to pass an evening.  Ho cenato qua ieri sera, che buona!!!
1412: Review: This restaurant qualifies as a true "find" in London....there's nothing quite like it anywhere else in the city. Yes, it is Italian cuisine, but only to the extent that it is really a glorious Tuscan steakhouse. Unless one is an unabashed carnivore, there is no reason to dine here....but, if delicious beef is one's "thing," it would be hard to do better. One immediately encounters the abundantly stocked raw beef showcase upon entering, behind which the wonderfully affable butcher, Lello (Rafaele) plies his skills and offers expert ordering advice. What follows is more than a delicious dining experience. The entire staff, Vincenzo, Georgia, and several others work in concert to provide warmth and humor in what might be described as the polar opposite of a stuffy dining experience. Terrific food, lovely wine, lots of laughs, casual attire....what more could one want?
1413: Review: Devo dire che sono stato davvero sorpreso. Non sono mai riuscito ad andare i Italia e per caso l'avevo dietro l'hotel a Londra. Il locale ha il numero di tavoli giusti ed gestito da ragazzi cordiali ed in gamba. Ottimo ed abbondante l'antipasto di salame e verdure ma meravigliosa la costata di manzo di Fassone Italiano..! Sugosa e tenerissima..il metodo Costa è senza dubbio sorprendente. Buona Cantina anche per il vino al bicchiere..i prezzi sono di Londra ma direi che ne vale la pena
1414: Review: Zunächst mal: Reservierung muss sein, und Ihre Abendgarderobe können Sie im Schrank lassen!Wir hatten Appetit auf Fleisch und bestellten nur Entrecote mit Rosmarin, Patate Arroste, Caponata und etwas Brot, Salat und Wein.Danach waren wir satt und zufrieden... Das Fleisch war einfach wunderbar, als Salat hätte ich mir statt des kalten Gemüsesalats (wir hatten ja schon Gemüse) einen frischen, grünen gewünscht, war aber auch so OK. Alles in diesem witzigen Lokal ist schnörkellos und unkompliziert. Die Bedienung war nett und zuvorkommend, nach Brot musste man aber erst fragen. Die Preise für das ausgezeichnete Fleisch sind durchaus in Ordnung,für die "Nebengeräusche" muss man allerdings etwas zu viel zahlen. Das ist halt wohl so in South Kensington. Insgesamt: sehr netter Abend!
1415: Title: ottima carne e assaggi di cucina nostrana a londra!!

Review: Quando stai un mese a Londra e ti manca la cucina casalinga tipica italiana, il Maxela è un'ottima cura contro la malinconia. La carne, che avevo già provato nel Maxela a Milano, è squisita e i cortesissimi ragazzi dello staff sono disponibili e attenti, spiegando nei minimi dettagli la provenienza e la preparazione di ogni piatto. Essendo con un gruppo di 4 amici, ho avuto l' occasione di assaggiare diversi piatti. In aggiunta alla carne, ottimi i salumi, decisamente particolari e gustosi (da assaggiare il salame di fassona), i taglierini al ragù e il latte dolce fritto.per quanto riguarda il prezzo, non ho ancora fatto l'abitudine al carovita londinese, ma nella media di altri ristoranti allo stesso livello, o anche inferiore, il rapporto qualità prezzo è molto buono.Tornerò sicuramente, anche perchè il manager mi ha detto che sono in arrivo per la stagione "estiva" delicatessen da caseifici pugliesi!!!!!!
1416: Title: Tutto, ma proprio tutto, eccellente

Review: Sono un cliente abituale di Maxela nella sua sede storica nel centro antico di Genova, trovandomi a Londra ho deciso di testare questa prestigiosa succursale del mio ristorante preferito. E le mie alte aspettetive sono state soddisfatte perfettamente!!!Fin da subito si respira un clima tipicamente italiano, sobriamente elegante e di quel gusto rusticheggiante che perfettamente si abbina alle prelibatezze offerte, sapientemente tratte dalle migliori ricette della cucina italiana. Il personale è stato di una cortesia squisita ed il servizio rapido e preciso. L'ambiente è caldo e familiare, senza comunque trascurare le accortezze dei più eleganti ristoranti che abbia frequentato. Di grande impatto e ideale per la scelta della propria carne, la vetrina/bancone di macelleria, visibile gia dalla strada.Ho ordinato un antipasto misto su tagliere davvero notevole, carne cruda delicata e gustosi formaggi e salumi. A seguire una cacio e pepe ottima, di cui ho apprezzato la perfetta cottura al dente della pasta. Ed infine il pezzo forte: una costata di manzo frollata. Più di un kg di carne che letteralmente si scioglie in bocca!! Il tutto accompagnato da un azzecato vino della regione delle dolomiti di cui nn ricordo il nome, consigliatomi dal maitre il quale mi ha accopagnato nella scelte delle portate, con tanto di spiegazione sull'origine di ogni prodotto. Più che onesto il rapporto qualità-prezzo, soprattutto in rapporto ai materiali di alta categoria utilizzati ed al costo medio dei ristoranti di livello di Londra.Un'ultima nota di merito: è possibile percepire la passione con cui lavorano in questo nuovo ed interessantissimo locale nella elegantissima South Kensington, e io stesso mi sono sentito orgoglioso per come viene esaltata in terra straniera la nostra nobile tradizione culinaria.Tornerò sicuramente
1417: Review: Had dinner at this restaurant 6th May and the Bistecca Fiorentina (56 sterling per kilo?!) was awesome! The starter platter of salami (standard Milano fare) bresaola (fantastico!) and lard (interestingly tasty topped with walnuts) was also up to scratch. The potatoes and vegetables were good but could use improvement! Our bottles of Barbera , too, were really good. Having a fluent Italian speaker in our dining group helped...the meat was cooked just right. I will return!!!
1418: Title: This must be te place

Review: I only went once in a Maxela restaurant in Italy, and i can remember it as a very nice experience, but when I accidentally met Maxela in South Kensington it took a second to get in..what an amazing sight! All these stunning meat out there! Who doesn't think " i want some??".So i got in and i met Roberto, who welcomed me and my friends just like we were old aged friends, a very nice person. After a minute I met the manager, Samuele, who took us and brought us to the meat and made us try all of the salame and breasola and that outstanding lard that i just used to dream in London! But then the strangest thing happened: they cut a very small piece of ribeye steak and made me try just the way it was,raw. It was so good, so fruity! We've had as starter a mix of raw meat, so amazing! And then, after the very good assistance of the waiters (and the very nice girl bartender) we took a ribeye( cooked but not too much!), a t bone steak and an "elephant ear"..magic! Ribeye steak cooked alla milanese..amazing!After a few bottles of a very good red wine suggested by the guys, we had amazing desserts such as tiramisu, and a quite heavy but worth of everypound the "latte dolce fritto"!Very nice experience, really looking forward to come back! And as you say, nice to meat you!
1419: Review: Sono stata in questo ristorante su consiglio di amici e devo dire che sono rimasta piacevolmente sorpresa! L'atmosfera è accogliente e "calda", grazie anche al giovane proprietario che è molto simpatico e cordiale; il cibo di ottima qualità...insomma è come sentirsi a casa propria pur stando all'estero! Abbiamo preso un primo piatto (fettucine al pesto) davvero squisito, una vera rarità in una città straniera; poi tutti secondi piatti conditi in modo davvero ottimo e particolare (come la tagliata noci e gorgonzola e quella alle pere), nei quali non si può non notare l'ottima qualità della carne; e poi contorni di verdure. Ottimo anche il loro tiramisù. L'unico piccolo "difetto" è che le porzioni non sono molto abbondanti, ma vi è il pregio di poter assaggiare molte cose senza uscire appesantiti. Il locale è molto carino, con un ampio banco della carne all'entrata e un vasto lucernario nella sala principale. I prezzi sono assolutamente nella norma per una città cara come Londra, soprattutto considerata l'ottima qualità del cibo. Lo consiglio assolutamente a tutti.
1420: Title: Great Florentine steak, warm & cosy atmosphere

Review: We had dinner at Maxela with a group of friends last week. Parma ham as starters, Chianti wine and 3 kg of Florentine T-bone steak. Great experience, the meat was excellent. Waitress was very friendly and helpful. Overall we had a great experience. Only the bill at the end that was unexpectly quite salty. I guess we had too much wine :)
1421: Review: Viaggio spesso per lavoro a Londra, e tendo spesso a visitare ristoranti etnici che lì possono essere davvero ottimi. Un amico mi ha portato in questo nuovo ristorante italiano a South Kensington, e nonostante il mio pregiudizio iniziale - andare a mangiare italiano a Londra... - ho dovuto ricredermi. Grandi carni, frollate al punto giusto, contorni mica male e primi molto buoni. Cantina dei vini interessante, con punte eccellenti. Il tutto con prezzi onesti - al confronto con quelli pazzeschi cui sono abituato a Londra. Ma quello che più mi è piaciuto è l'atmosfera del locale, sembra di essere nella cantina di una fattoria del Chianti, e mi trovavo in Old Brompton Road. Non che io non sia goloso, ma anche l'occhio...Servizio puntuale e professionale, si vede che i ragazzi che ti servono sanno quello che fanno e sono fieri del loro ristorante. Ci tornerò, alla faccia di involtini primavera e simili!
1422: Review: I went there with 2friends of mine in a busy night as apparently it looks every night.. We had a plate of mix raw meat which was to die for!! Then we had an amazing 2 kilos steak as rare as possible,blue!! Simply amazing,I've never tasted something like that!! Cannellini beans and grilled veg marinated were good sides. Said this what made the difference were the atmosphere along with the staff!! Wonderful!! Great knowledge and big smiles always! We'll definitevely be back! Cheers Maxela!!!
1423: Review: Sono stata al maxela molte volte, mi sono innamorata dell'atmosfera accogliente e dal cibo delizioso! È sempre bello poter trovare un posto dove sentirsi a casa mentre si viaggia, per questo quando vado a Londra mangiare nella mia macelleria preferita è una tappa obbligatoria! Lo consiglio a tutti!
1424: Review: As I live in the neighbourhood I have eaten here a few times - my friends, who eat steak, like it. I don't - but i am a vegetarian. I ordered the gnoccchi - the portion size is offensively small, it is supposed to be a main course but I could literally fit the entire contents of the plate in one hand. I was hungry afterwards and I am a small girl. I think the concept is good but its could be executed better.
1425: Review: kept walking by and was never sure what this was all about so decied to try......I agree with others great steak but not so impressed with the sides....and other offerings. Had gnoccchi, being a great fan I was a bi disappointed. i think it may be made in the restraurant but not daily. ould not order again.The steak was another story one of the best I have had in London...go for the steak...Service was good but not fantastic . They need a bi of order. Never was offered bread. That said wait staff was friendly.I suggest these guys do what they do best. Butchers at entrance were impressive but was never told I could go out to counter and order special cut.Good meal not sure I would rush backJW Steak Grosvenor Hotel stillmy favorite
1426: Title: Ristorante italiano diverso dai soliti cliché

Review: Ho trovato questo ristorante sulla pagina Facebook del Gambero Rosso, ho guardato il sito e ho deciso subito di prenotare tramite Top Table per il nostro piccolo viaggio a Londra ed è stata un'ottima decisione. Il locale è a South Kensington, quartiere chic della metropoli, riconoscibile per il banco della macelleria..in vetrina! Siamo entrati e ci siamo accorti di essere tornati in Italia! Appena lo staff ha capito la nostra nazionalità siamo stati accolti con ancora più gentilezza e calore, siamo stati accompagnati nella saletta dietro la macelleria (!!) e subito il maître è arrivato per fare la nostra conoscenza, erano quasi stupiti, la loro clientela tipo credo non sia il turista italiano, ma l'inglese appassionato di carne e di cibi..liguri! Infatti sul menù c'erano minestrone alla genovese e taglierini al pesto.. Oltre a carne cotta e cruda! Noi avevamo già studiato il menù quindi abbiamo preso: tagliata con rucola e ricotta salata, polpette con patate e hamburger con lardo e miele. Tutto ottimo, ma un piccolo appunto devo farlo sui contorni, scarsi e sembravano riscaldati, le patate arrosto erano molli c'è, come se fossero state cotte in precedenza e poi scaldate, peccato. Abbiamo bevuto birra, Nastro Azzurro che ci hanno detto di gran moda in UK, e acqua gassata. Il conto era sui 45 pounds, le porzioni abbondanti, l'ambiente ottimo. Ci hanno detto di avere ristoranti in Italia, anche a Genova e Milano, quindi credo che proverò anche quelli. Un apprezzamento allo staff, cordiale, ma non eccessivo.
1427: Review: Walked past the restaurant and we were totally intriqued by the window display. Initially told they did not have a table but they kindly sorted it out for us after a few alterations! ! The food and service was exceptional and we felt very welcome and waiters and the butcher were all very passionate about the service and the meat. An excellent experience which i can highly recommend although not cheap. We shall definately return..
1428:
Review: This restauraunt is for those who love thir meat!  Vegetarians beware!  

We were looking for something different and found it in Maxela.  A great concept, friendly and welcoming staff, and good food.   We had a really great night.
1429: Title: when eating becomes an experience!!!!
Review: enter the restaurant and feel at home, a friendly staff and the smiling, vote 10, eat raw meat and stay to enjoy the flavors of Italian! a unique experience, well done!!
1430: Title: Great meat, side dishes could be better

Review: Having eaten at Maxela within a couple of weeks of opening, this first experience delivered a great cut of meat, whilst not cheap, my steak was fantastic, however the accompanying sides dishes were a total disappointment, soggy fries and limp old salad. Several months on I decided to give it another try. Again the steak was excellent, service was good, fries better but again a limp basic salad that just lacked any creativity or flavour....also no English mustard!!!These guys have a great concept but with a little more thought and effort they would justify the price tag as I still came away feeling slightly disappointed.
1431: Title: Very tasty steak and desserts

Review: We found Maxela by walking along Old Brompton Road - we were intrigued by the combo of an Italian butchers and restaurants. We checked out some reviews and booked a table for a Sunday night. We were initially disappointed because the waiter was a little difficult for us to understand and vice versa, leading to confusion over our choice of a meat and bread platter. Also the chianti we wanted wasn't available. However the alternative wine suggestion turned out to be lovely, if £10 more expensive. We both choose Tagilere dishes (strips of Fassone steak) for main course, which was delicious, if a little chewy in places. The highlight of the meal though were the desserts - deep fried sweet milk (with nutella or sugar) and chocolate torte. Both were superb desserts, not too heavy and very tasty.
1432: Review: The first time i walked past Maxela i thought it was a butcher's.... but if you look past the meat counter, you can see a very cosy small restaurant. We walked in tonight (friday) without a booking, and were greeted by a very friendly waiter who assured us that in the next 15 minutes a table would be free, and we could seat at the bar while we waited. The wine list is small, but provides a good choicE of wine ranging from 25 to 100 GBP. We had a platter of excellent quality cold cuts while waiting. The food was good quality throughout - both the pasta dish and the meat were very good, and the dessert (fried sweet milk) was absolutely amazing. Service is very friendly (it helps if you speak italian, but you dont have too). The one piece of advice is to try and seat in the front vs back room... we were at the front for drinks before dinner, and at the backfor dinner: the back is way too noisy and at times we could not hear each other. All in all a great little restaurant.
1433: Review: I went to Maxela with my boyfriend, who goes crazy about meat, and it was absolutely the right place for us! We had some salumi to start, and then I had a tagliata with lard and onions, while he had a costata steak. All we had was very tasty and well presented, and we really liked the fact that you can go in front of the butcher and choose your cut of meat as well as get information about the meat. The desserts were fantastic then, and also Poggio alla Scottona wine was very nice. We'll definetely be back.
1434: Title: The best steak I've ever eaten!

Review: We went to Maxela for lunch and have already booked to go again, it's my new favourite restaurant in London! The restaurant is an Italian butchery with a wonderful meat counter. You chose the cut of meat you would like along with the weight and it is then cooked to your liking. The staff were very attentive helping us decide on which cut of meat to have, advising the difference between the cuts and the aging of each cut. They also recommended a wonderful wine which complimented our lunch perfectly. We chose to have a 1kg ribeye aged to 45 days along with roast potatoes and grilled vegetables for 2 people which was plenty. As the meat was cut we were offered a taste before it was taken to the kitchen to be cooked, it was like nothing I'd eaten before, truly outstanding. It was served to our table already carved and cooked to perfection. The taste and texture was divine and I can say hand on heart, it was the tastiest steak I have ever eaten and I've eaten a lot! We couldn't leave without tasting the home made tiramisu which was again outstanding. Needless to say, a visit to this restaurant is a must for any meat lovers, vegetarians beware!
1435: Title: great lunch offer and fantastic meat and pasta

Review: maxela has a fantastic lunch offer (pasta as a starter and then a small meat dish) with some of the best gnocchi I have ever had! the menu does not come cheap if you eat à la carte, but food isdefinitely worth it. their staff is friendly and seems to be proud to work there - loyts of explanations abouit the concept and the food. our waiter came from bari and we enjoyed!
1436: Review: We went to Maxela as my dining partner is a bit of a carnivore. I had checked them out online beforehand and looked at their site (which also needs improvement) which really doesn't do the space justice.The concept is great, pick your cut of meat and order it as you like it cooked. I choose the braesola to start which was very nice, my partner ordered minestrone but a vegetable soup arrived, we questioned whether it was minestrone (it wasn't) but we were assured that it was.Mains arrived, I ordered sirloin which was badly cooked and unfortunately not a great cut. My partner ordered a rump which he was really looking forward to-it arrived cut up into strips and not cooked to his liking so we sent it back. The wait staff brought it back without query. While the experience was an enjoyable one, I think they need to really concentrate on their menu and how it is presented to the diners. A restaurant like this which specialises in meat really needs to be able to cook it and present it as it's ordered. It has great potential and I hope it does well. The staff were very pleasant but I think they need to focus on what's important. The food.I wish them luck.
1437: Review: Meat is just excellent, BUT..Unfortunately we went twice and both times they forgot something. First time the main course (after 1 hour waiting they hadn't realize we were still waiting the meat); second time the meat arrived with no sides orders ( we had to ask again for potatos and grilled vegetables which arrived well after the meat was finished).and they kept the attitude instead of being apologetic.perhaps a block-notes when taking the orders would help.
